DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: Marcos V. T. Heckler;Heckler, M.V.T.;Heckler, Marcos V. T.;Heckler, Marcos;Heckler, Marcos V.T.;MARCOS HECKLER

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduaчуo em Engenharia Elщtrica - ъnfase em Eletrєnica pela Universidade Federal de Santa Maria (2001), mestrado em Engenharia Eletrєnica e Computaчуo pelo Instituto Tecnolѓgico de Aeronсutica (2003) e doutorado em Engenharia Elщtrica pela Universidade Tщcnica de Munique (2010). Atualmente, щ professor associado junto р Universidade Federal do Pampa (UNIPAMPA), Campus Alegrete, em Alegrete, RS. Atuou como coordenador do curso de graduaчуo em Engenharia de Telecomunicaчѕes de 2012 a 2015 e 2017 a 2019, como coordenador do Programa de Pѓs-Graduaчуo em Engenharia Elщtrica (PPGEE), e como Coordenador de Pѓs-Graduaчуo Lato Sensu da UNIPAMPA. Possui experiъncia na сrea de Engenharia de Telecomunicaчѕes, com ъnfase no projeto e anсlise de antenas, teoria eletromagnщtica e circuitos de micro-ondas, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: projeto de antenas para telemetria, comunicaчѕes e navegaчуo, anсlise de antenas embarcadas em aeronaves, e no desenvolvimento de mщtodos numщricos para a anсlise de antenas de microfita conformadas sobre superfэcies cilэndricas.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Mr. Heckler received the BSc. degree in Electrical Engineering (Emphasis in Electronics) from Universidade Federal de Santa Maria (UFSM), Brazil, in 2001, the MSc. degree in Electronic Engineering (Microwaves and Optoelectronics) from Instituto Tecnolѓgico de Aeronсutica (ITA), Brazil, in 2003, and the Dr.-Ing. degree in Electrical Engineering from Technische Universitфt Mќnchen (TUM), Germany, in 2010. He is currently an Professor at Universidade Federal do Pampa, Brazil. He worked as the Dean for Communications Engineering from 2012 to 2015 and 2017 to 2019 and as the coordinator of the Master Program in Electrical Engineering of UNIPAMPA. His current research interests are: the design of microstrip antennas and arrays for telemetry, comunications and navigation, analysis of antennas installed on aircraft, and the development of numerical techniques for conformal microstrip antennas.

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Anсlise de Antenas Instaladas sobre Aeronaves
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Anсlise de antenas instaladas sobre aeronaves com o objetivo de estimar a sua performance, alщm de permitir a otimizaчуo da posiчуo de antenas para melhorar as caracterэsticas de irradiaчуo e acoplamento mњtuo (no caso de antenas operando simultaneamente) . As atividades de pesquisa foram desenvolvidas no тmbito do projeto IPAS (Installed Performance of Antennas on Aerostructures), que foi executado por um consѓrcio composto por 10 empresas europщias. O projeto IPAS foi financiado pela Uniуo Europщia
Desenvolver mщtodos numщricos para a anсlise de antenas de microfita conformadas sobre superfэcies cilэndricas e quase-cilэndricas
Projeto e anсlise de redes de antenas (especialmente em tecnologia de microfita) para aplicaчѕes como comunicaчѕes via satщlite e receptores para sistemas de rсdio-navegaчуo (sistemas GNSS)
Projeto de antenas de microfita (elemento simples passivo ou ativo) para comunicaчѕes via satщlite e rсdio-navegaчуo (sistemas GNSS)

Anсlise e projeto de antenas de microfita conformadas sobre superfэcies cilэndricas. O enfoque desta linha de pesquisa estс no desenvolvimento de mщtodos numщricos para elementos simples, bem como para a anсlise de redes de antenas conformadas utilizando mщtodos empэricos (cavidade ressonante) e de onda completa (discrete mode matching)

O projeto IPAS teve como principal objetivo avaliar a precisуo que pode ser obtida na determinaчуo das caracterэsticas eletromagnщticas de antenas instaladas sobre a superfэcie de aeronaves utilizando-se as atuais tщcnicas numщricas. PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Smart Antenna Terminal II - SANTANA II
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
O projeto SANTANA II visou ao desenvolvimento de um sistema composto por duas redes de antenas planas circularmente polarizadas para a transmissуo e recepчуo de sinais em banda larga via satщlite. O sistema de transmissуo opera em 29,75 GHz e o de recepчуo em 19,95 GHz. Ambas as redes de antenas sуo controladas por um computador, que controla os diagramas de irradiaчуo de cada uma das redes atravщs de tщcnicas de beamforming. Na fase II do projeto SANTANA, o hardware necessсrio para demonstrar o princэpio de funcionamento do sistema foi implementado. Cada uma das redes щ composta por 64 (8x8) antenas, construэdas em tecnologia de microfita.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
O projeto UniTaS IV teve como objetivo a anсlise e a implementaчуo de vсrios sistemas e sub-sistemas de receptores para rсdio-navegaчуo por satщlite. Neste projeto, o Centro Aeroespacial Alemуo teve como principal atividade o projeto de uma rede de antenas 2x2 para a recepчуo de sinais de GPS na faixa de L1. Melhora da relaчуo sinal-ruэdo e a supressуo de interferъncia causada por sinais dentro da faixa de L1 sуo obtidos atravщs da utilizaчуo de tщcnicas de beamforming. Fora da faixa, os sinais interferentes sуo atenuados pelos filtros dos receptores, bem como por um projeto otimizado dos elementos que compѕem a rede de antenas.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Estudo e desenvolvimento de antenas para telefonia mѓvel celular
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Este projeto teve por objetivo o estudo e projeto de redes de antenas de microfita para aplicaчѕes em estaчѕes rсdio base (ERB) para telefonia mѓvel celular. Para que a cobertura de sinal dentro de uma cщlula seja aproximadamente homogъnea, faz-se necessсrio o projeto de uma antena que apresente um diagrama de irradiaчуo, que deve apresentar valor mсximo de ganho nas direчѕes limites da regiуo de cobertura de uma ERB, diminuindo gradativamente para valores menores atщ as vizinhanчas da torre de transmissуo/recepчуo. Para atingir tal objetivo, tщcnicas de conformaчуo de feixe (do inglъs, beamforming), juntamente com mщtodos rсpidos de anсlise eletromagnщtica das antenas foram empregados. Para este fim, uma ferramenta computacional foi desenvolvida para otimizaчуo das correntes de excitaчуo da rede de antenas. Edital MCT/CNPq 14/2011 - Universal
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Este projeto visa ao estudo e projeto de redes de antenas de microfita para aplicaчѕes em estaчѕes rсdio base (ERB) para telefonia mѓvel celular. Para que a cobertura de sinal dentro de uma cщlula seja aproximadamente homogъnea, faz-se necessсrio o projeto de uma antena que apresente um diagrama de irradiaчуo, que deve apresentar valor mсximo de ganho nas direчѕes limites da regiуo de cobertura de uma ERB, diminuindo gradativamente para valores menores atщ as vizinhanчas da torre de transmissуo/recepчуo. Para atingir tal objetivo, tщcnicas de conformaчуo de feixe (do inglъs, beamforming), juntamente com mщtodos rсpidos de anсlise eletromagnщtica das antenas deverуo ser empregados. Desta forma, pretende-se desenvolver uma ferramenta computacional que execute a otimizaчуo das correntes de excitaчуo da rede de antenas. Edital MCT/CNPq 14/2011 - Universal

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Projeto de novas antenas dupla-faixa com ъnfase para sistemas de rсdio-navegaчуo
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Neste projeto, foram desenvolvidas novas topologias de antenas para operaчуo em duas faixas de freqќъncia. Como principal diferencial em relaчуo рs topologias jс existentes, a antena estudada apresenta geometria em fenda anelar. Tal caracterэstica foi pouco explorada na literatura atщ o momento. Esta topologia apresentou construчуo simples, semelhante рs tradicionais antenas. Para validar o desempenho da antena, protѓtipos foram construэdos e caracterizados experimentalmente. Edital FAPERGS 001/2011 - ARD (Auxэlio Recщm-Doutor)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Neste projeto, serуo desenvolvidas novas topologias de antenas para operaчуo em duas faixas de freqќъncia. Como principal diferencial em relaчуo рs topologias jс existentes, pretende-se desenvolver uma nova antena que separe as duas bandas de freqќъncia em duas saэdas altamente isoladas uma da outra. Tal caracterэstica foi pouco explorada na literatura atщ o momento. Alщm disso, esta topologia deverс apresentar construчуo mais simples do que as tradicionais antenas de dupla faixa com estrutura multi-camada. A nova geometria serс otimizada para operaчуo em sistemas de rсdio-navegaчуo por satщlite. Para validar o desempenho da antena que serс proposta, protѓtipos serуo construэdos e caracterizados experimentalmente. Edital FAPERGS 001/2011 - ARD (Auxэlio Recщm-Doutor)

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O projeto de pesquisa ?NOVAS ANTENAS PARA RECEPЧУO DE DADOS AMBIENTAIS EM NANO SATЩLITES PARA O PROJETO CONASAT? щ dedicado ao estudo de novos substratos, novas geometrias de antenas de microfita e estratщgias de processamento de sinais para uso em nano-satщlites para o sistema de coleta de dados ambientais associado ao projeto CONASAT (Constelaчуo Nano-Satщlites Ambientais - http://www.crn2.inpe.br/conasat1/index.php). PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Estudo de redes de antenas retro-diretivas
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Este projeto visa ao estudo de redes de antenas retro-diretivas, que sуo antenas com capacidade de retransmitir um sinal com alta diretividade na mesma direчуo de onde o sinal foi originalmente recebido. A rede a ser estudada serс composta de antenas dupla-faixa e com dupla-polarizaчуo. Ъnfase serс dada ao projeto em tecnologia de microfita. Serуo desenvolvidos circuitos de RF para amplificaчуo do sinal recebido pela rede antes da retransmissуo. Em especial, serс realizado um estudo para avaliaчуo dos efeitos do desbalanceamento de amplitude e fase nos circuitos de RF, produzidos pelas tolerтncias de fabricaчуo dos componentes ativos do protѓtipo, no diagrama de irradiaчуo da rede retro-diretiva. Ao final do projeto, um protѓtipo para demonstraчуo da retro-diretividade serс construэdo e caracterizado experimentalmente.

Este projeto visa ao estudo e desenvolvimento de antenas para nanossatщlites no padrуo CubeSat,
para continuidade das atividades que jс se encontram em andamento no Laboratѓrio de Eletromagnetismo, Micro-Ondas e Antenas (LEMA) do Campus Alegrete. No projeto anterior, trabalhou-se unicamente com satщlites de tamanho 8 U; entretanto, o presente projeto serс dedicado a estudos para satщlites de diferentes dimensѕes, sendo o principal desafio a obtenчуo de antenas compactas, de baixo peso e baixo volume para instalaчуo em pequenos satщlites. As antenas projetadas deverуo ser prototipadas e ensaiadas no LEMA

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Prospecчуo da utilizaчуo de radares de abertura sintщtica para aplicaчѕes em agricultura e monitoramento ambiental
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Este projeto trata do estudo do potencial de tщcnicas de radar de abertura sintщtica (do inglъs,
synthetic aperture radar ? SAR) para aplicaчѕes tэpicas em agricultura de precisуo e monitoramento
ambiental. A partir de uma revisуo bibliogrсfica inicial, serуo identificadas as principais especificaчѕes
necessсrias para projeto de um sistema baseado em SAR. Finalmente, protѓtipos em laboratѓrio serуo
projetados com o intuito de demonstraчуo de alguns dos principais subsistemas

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricaчуo de Aparelhos e Equipamentos de Telecomunicaчуo

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper discusses a new microstrip antenna array for wireless communication. Initially, the basic array element, an E-shaped probe-fed patch, is analyzed by comparisons between numerical and measured results. After that, a two-element subarray is discussed. Simulated results, obtained by using Ensemble 8.0 and IE3D packages, and experimental ones are presented. Good agreement between these results is obtained. Finally, a six-element array is designed and analyzed by numerical computations

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo:

O programa AMCLR, desenvolvido no Instituto Tecnolѓgico de Aeronсutica - ITA - com o objetivo de analisar e sintetizar redes planares, circularmente polarizadas, do tipo phased array, щ o foco deste trabalho. Inicialmente, a geometria do elemento irradiador da rede щ discutida. Em seguida, a anсlise de uma rede planar 2x2 щ realizada com o AMCLR, visando determinar as fases das correntes de excitaчуo de seus elementos, de modo que o lѓbulo principal aponte para uma direчуo prщ-determinada do espaчo. Utilizando o programa Ensemble 8.0, essa rede щ re-analisada considerando-se as mesmas fases nas correntes de excitaчуo dos elementos calculadas pelo AMCLR. O trabalho apresenta comparaчѕes entre os diagramas de irradiaчуo obtidos pelo AMCLR e pelo Ensemble 8.0

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 2003 SBMO/IEEE MTT-S International Microwave and Optoelectronics Conference - IMOC 2003

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper describes a homemade developed CAD package to design and analyze rectangular probe-fed microstrip antennas conformed on cylindrical structures. This CAD (named Cylindrical) provides a friendly environment, making the design and analysis of these antennas easy. The theory used to develop the software is described first. Then, a right-handed circularly polarized antenna to operate at 2.25 GHz is designed. The main characteristics of this element, such as input impedance, axial ratio and radiation patterns are presented. The theoretical results show good agreement when compared with experimental data

Then, a right-handed circularly polarized antenna to operate at 2.25 GHz is designed. The main characteristics of this element, such as input impedance, axial ratio and radiation patterns are presented. The theoretical results show good agreement when compared with experimental data

Resumo:

Este trabalho apresenta um algoritmo para a sэntese de antenas de microfita retangulares, circularmente polarizadas, moldadas sobre superfэcies cilэndricas e alimentadas por provas de corrente. Inicialmente, as expressѕes para o projeto sуo estabelecidas. Comparaчѕes entre resultados teѓricos e experimentais sуo mostradas para antenas operando em 2,25 GHz
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract:

This paper presents an algorithm to design probe-fed circularly polarized rectangular microstrip antennas conformed on cylindrical surfaces. Initially, the equations to the design are presented. Comparisons between theoretical and experimental results at 2.25 GHz are shown

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo:

Neste trabalho sуo analisadas redes de antenas de microfita retangulares moldadas sobre superfэcies cilэndricas. Expressѕes para os campos distantes sуo estabelecidas com emprego da transformada dupla de Fourier e o modelo da cavidade ressonante. Finalmente, o estudo de uma rede circularmente polarizada potencialmente њtil para aplicaчуo em veэculos aeroespaciais щ apresentado
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract:

This paper presents the analysis of cylindrical conformal arrays of rectangular microstrip antennas. The far field expressions are established under the application of the Double Fourier Transform technique and the cavity model. Finally, a circularly polarized conformal array potential for aerospace applications is studied

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

Microstrip antennas have several attractive characteristics for space applications, such as light weight, low profile and conformability. For space vehicle applications, an isotropic radiation patteern may be desired in order t establish a reliable telemetry link. Another important feature of such a link is the polarization of the ground and the embedded antennas. The use of circularly polarized (CP) antennas reduces the polarization mismatch between these antennas, increasing the link efficiency. The circumferential array analysis with such characteristics has been reported in the literature (D.I. Wu, IEEE Antennas and Prop. Symp. Dig., pp. 998-1011, 1995; H.D. Weinschel, ibid., pp. 177-180, 1975), but no comments are made on the influence of the number of elements on the quality of the circular polarization. For the aforementioned reasons, the purpose of this paper is to analyze CP microstrip antenna arrays conformed on cylindrical surfaces in order to achieve a suitable radiation pattern for telemetry of space vehicles
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract:

Microstrip antennas have several attractive characteristics for space applications, such as light weight, low profile and conformability. For space vehicle applications, an isotropic radiation patteern may be desired in order t establish a reliable telemetry link. Another important feature of such a link is the polarization of the ground and the embedded antennas. The use of circularly polarized (CP) antennas reduces the polarization mismatch between these antennas, increasing the link efficiency. The circumferential array analysis with such characteristics has been reported in the literature (D.I. Wu, IEEE Antennas and Prop. Symp. Dig., pp. 998-1011, 1995; H.D. Weinschel, ibid., pp. 177-180, 1975), but no comments are made on the influence of the number of elements on the quality of the circular polarization. For the aforementioned reasons, the purpose of this paper is to analyze CP microstrip antenna arrays conformed on cylindrical surfaces in order to achieve a suitable radiation pattern for telemetry of space vehicles

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo:

Neste trabalho щ apresentado um procedimento alternativo para o cсlculo, no domэnio espectral, dos campos eletromagnщticos irradiados por uma antena de abertura localizada em uma superfэcie cilэndrica perfeitamente condutora. A validaчуo desse procedimento щ realizada analisando-se as caracterэsticas de campos distantes de uma antena de microfita retangular. Diagramas de irradiaчуo para os modos TM10 e TM01 sуo apresentados e discutidos. Os resultados experimentais encontram-se em boa concordтncia com as previsѕes teѓricas

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the Joint XIX Spanish URSI/COST 284 Meeting

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents an effective algorithm to design probe-fed rectangular microstrip antenna conformed on cylindrical structures. A homemade CAD package was developed using this algorithm, making the design and analysis of this kind of antenna easy. The expressions for the main antenna characteristics were found using the cavity model. After obtaining the synthesis expressions, the design process is described for an antenna operating at the L1 GPS frequency (1575.42 MHz). Input impedance, radiation patterns and axial ratio were computed. Analyses of the sensibility of the antenna parameters with the substrate permittivity are presented. Finally, experimental results are shown and compared with the theoretical predictions. Two prototypes were necessary to obtain an optimized geometry

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 2005 IEEE AP-S International Symposium

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

The determination of the radiation patterns of antennas installed on airframes is not always an easy task. Patterns can be measured by performing in-flight tests, which are very expensive and allow the determination of only few cuts. Another limitation is that only few samples are obtained (in general, at every 10А) [1]. An alternative is down scaling all the dimensions of the aircraft and of the antenna, and scaling up the measurement frequency. In this case, a scaled model of the antenna is necessary and mock-ups of the aircraft can be used. These are some of the topics being studied in the IPAS (Installed Performance of Antennas on Aerostructures) project. As a partial result of the investigations, this paper presents the analysis of monopoles installed on airframes considering the use of different techniques and different discretization criteria. Antennas operating at 126 MHz and at 1 GHz (full scale) are analyzed and the results compared with radiation patterns measured using a 1/12th scaled mock up. Despite the simplicity of the radiators, the results obtained in this study are important to serve as guidelines for the analysis of more complex antennas on airframes. The analyses were performed using the CAD model shown in Fig. 1, which is a simplified model of the ATR 42 aircraft with 180 surfaces. This is an important point to consider in order to generate a mesh with better quality and fewer elements [2]. The simulations for this work have been performed using FEKO electromagnetic simulator

Abstract:

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

Microstrip antennas are very well suited to conformal array applications. Mounted on cylindrical surfaces, most of the developments emphasize the design of N-element wraparound arrays for omnidirectional radiation in the cylindrical roll planes. This paper reports the design of a circularly polarized (CP) circumferential array for the SONDA IV, a Brazilian sounding rocket. Using an effective home made CAD tool (Cylindrical), the minimum number of radiating elements needed to obtain a radiation characteristic as close as possible to an isotropic pattern was determined. Then, constructive details were taken into account in order to finally define the total number of antennas. To validate our assumptions and the design procedure, a prototype of a sub-array of four CP microstrip patches was manufactured, and the tests results show very good agreement with the simulations
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract:

Microstrip antennas are very well suited to conformal array applications. Mounted on cylindrical surfaces, most of the developments emphasize the design of N-element wraparound arrays for omnidirectional radiation in the cylindrical roll planes. This paper reports the design of a circularly polarized (CP) circumferential array for the SONDA IV, a Brazilian sounding rocket. Using an effective home made CAD tool (Cylindrical), the minimum number of radiating elements needed to obtain a radiation characteristic as close as possible to an isotropic pattern was determined. Then, constructive details were taken into account in order to finally define the total number of antennas. To validate our assumptions and the design procedure, a prototype of a sub-array of four CP microstrip patches was manufactured, and the tests results show very good agreement with the simulations

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

In this paper, monopoles installed on an airframe are analyzed using different discretization criteria, as well as different numerical techniques. First, monopoles installed on a commercial aircraft are analyzed when operating at VHF frequencies (Communications Antennas). Then, using asymptotic techniques, antennas operating at 1 GHz (Air Traffic Control Antennas), installed on the same aircraft, are analyzed. Comparisons between predicted and measured results are shown and discussed along the paper

Comparisons between predicted and measured results are shown and discussed along the paper

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

In this work, beamforming analyses on a broadband antenna array designed for the whole Galileo frequency band are shown. The beamforming software was developed by the DLR antenna group and employs a combination of an optimized Chebychev pattern with the sample matrix inversion (SMI) algorithm. This paper begins with a description of the antenna array used for the simulations and its antenna element, and then the construction concepts are presented and commented. Finally, the results of the beamforming analyses are shown and discussed

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents results from investigations carried out by DLR regarding installed performance of antennas on airframes. For the electromagnetic analyses, different simulation methods have been used. The results have been compared with measurements using a scaled mock-up at a higher frequency. The paper presents a discussion about the results obtained with both techniques, including a discretization analysis to infer whether the predictions could be still improved if the mesh modelling of the airframe is refined

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper deals with a modular Rx- and Tx- antenna
terminal featuring digital beamforming (DBF) at Ka-band
frequencies. Background and vision of the project SANTANA II
and recent realizations are described. Different system
components are outlined covering digital baseband, RF- and IFlevel
as well as software aspects. An outlook on mobile field tests,
which will be reported at the conference, concludes this
contribution

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

Microstrip antennas are very well suited for the conformal integration into the surface of vehicles, vessels or airplanes, mainly because they are flexible and can be adapted to almost any kind of structure. In aeronautics, new materials like GLARE (glass-fiber reinforced aluminum) are composed of several thin layers resulting in a multilayer architecture, when stacked patches have to be integrated for broadband applications. The analysis of these structures using commercial simulation tools with full 3D-modeling is difficult and time consuming
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract:

Microstrip antennas are very well suited for the conformal integration into the surface of vehicles, vessels or airplanes, mainly because they are flexible and can be adapted to almost any kind of structure. In aeronautics, new materials like GLARE (glass-fiber reinforced aluminum) are composed of several thin layers resulting in a multilayer architecture, when stacked patches have to be integrated for broadband applications. The analysis of these structures using commercial simulation tools with full 3D-modeling is difficult and time consuming

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents a systematic way to set up the dyadic Green?s function for multilayer structures us-ing a full-wave equivalent circuit (FWEC) in curvilinear coordinate systems. The FWEC forms a basis for the efficient analysis of planar, cylindrical and spherical structures with the integral-equation technique in the spectral domain, and for the application of DMM on arbitrarily shaped structures (quasi-planar, quasi-circular cylindrical) in the space domain. In order to test the applicability of the equivalent-circuit approach and demon-strate its excellent potential and versatility, dielectric cylindrical waveguides with an index profile have been investigated, where the profile has been approximated by up to 10,000 homogeneous layers with different permittivity. Several additional examples are shown for the application of the FWEC like the analysis of patch antennas on a deformed (quasi-planar) substrate and of micro-strip lines on a three-layer cylindrical substrate using DMM, and the coupling of patch antennas on a cylinder using a method-of-moments approach. All results have been validated as far as possible by using commercial software

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper describes computations and measurements of mutual coupling between rectangular microstrip antennas mounted on a cylindrical surface. The computations have been done with commercial software and with the microstrip conformal antenna analysis tool (MCAT), which is a program developed by DLR. Measurements have been carried out for validation

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

The work carried out within Work Package 2.4-3 of the EU network ?Antenna Centre of Excellence? (ACE) is presented in this paper. This work package is concerned with structuring research on conformal antennas. In more details, the work is focused on the problems associated with full benchmarking of conformal antennas, on development of hybrid programs for analyzing different classes of conformal antennas, and on investigation of properties of algorithms for optimizing beam synthesis and beam-steering for conformal arrays

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents the analysis of antennas installed on aircraft. The aim is to validate the numerical pre-dictions of installed performance obtained with commercial software by means of measurements using scaled mock-ups of aircraft used in the civil aviation. The design of the antennas used for this validation is described first. Then, details regarding the simulations are presented. Finally, comparisons between simulations and measurements are shown and discussed

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents computations and measurements of installed performance of microstrip arrays on aerostructures. Due to the large electrical size of the airframe, the simulations have been performed using physical optics and the multi-level fast multipole method. These computations are validated by measurements in the antenna test range at DLR Oberpfaffenhofen. A comparison between the numerical and experimental results is presented. The details concerning the electromagnetic simulations are given in this paper

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents the analysis of waveguides with
noncircular cross sections under the application of the discrete
mode matching (DMM). The structure is represented by an
equivalent circuit, which is used to set up the system equations
to compute the propagation constant for the case under analysis.
To demonstrate the application of the method, elliptical dielectric
waveguides and conformal striplines are analyzed

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract: 

Advanced global navigation satellite systems (GNSS) like Galileo and modernized GPS will provide new services and thus require corresponding improvements on the navigation receiving systems, since interference and multipath signals can cause unacceptable performance degradation. For safety-of-life (SoL) applications, new beam-forming and signal-processing algorithms will be employed to overcome this problem. These procedures enable a more accurate and reliable navigation solution by suppressing interference and multipath signals and improving the reception of useful line-of-sight satellite signals. For the development and testing of these algorithms and in order to demonstrate new applications the Institute of Communications and Navigation of the German Aerospace Center (DLR) is building up a GNSS receiver demonstrator with improved capabilities for interference and multipath mitigation by utilization of array processing techniques. The aim is to develop a complete safety-of-life (SoL) receiver system including antenna array, RF front-end, digital signal processing, navigation solution and integrity assessment. This paper gives an overview of the general terminal concept and the system architecture. Also a first realization comprising a sub-array of four modules (2x2 array) with a subsequent four channel RF front end for GPS/Galileo L1 signal reception is presented

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

For the design and analysis of planar antenna arrays the simulation tool SEQAR based on MATLABreg has been developed. With the help of single element radiation patterns from simulations with commercial software or measurements it offers the possibility of beamforming and beamsteering with arbitrarily rotated elements in a wide range of array configurations. The integrated array editor allows the fast and easy assembly of antenna arrays. Both big arrays and arrays with non-uniform spacing can be efficiently designed and analyzed. Mutual coupling between the antenna elements can be taken into account and its undesired effects alleviated by decoupling algorithms
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

Mutual coupling between the antenna elements can be taken into account and its undesired effects alleviated by decoupling algorithms

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

On-ground measurements using full-scale airplanes demand a large open area that may not be completely free from other reflections than those coming from the ground. Moreover, if measurements are to be done in an airport, the electromagnetic environment may be very noisy, which can affect the measurement accuracy. During the on-ground tests that we performed, the presence of an airplane close to the measurement site could not be avoided. This contributed to inaccuracies obtained in the measured results as previously discussed. In the other directions, where the presence of this aircraft is not supposed to influence the measurements significantly, the agreement between the measurements and the numerical predictions was very good
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

In this paper, we investigate the phase centre variations of a 2x2 uniform rectangular adaptive antenna array that is part of the demonstrator of a GPS/Galileo array receiver. The array is built up of antenna elements optimised for the reception of GPS/Galileo signals in the L1 band with a simultaneous suppression of interference from 1710?1785 MHz GSM band. For enabling realistic simulations, the radiation patterns of the antenna elements are obtained by full-wave electromagnetic simulations with Ansoft Designer that take into account the mutual coupling. We investigate the phase centre variations with the following beamforming techniques: the unconstrained adaptive null steering, the linearly constrained minimum variance (LCMV) and reference signal LMS beamforming. The simulations of the beamforming techniques are performed with the help of DLR in-house software multi-antenna GNSS receiver

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 3rd European Conference on Antennas and Propagation - EuCAP 2009

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents the background, the vision, and
the motivation of the SANTANA project (Smart Antenna
Terminal). Recent realizations of electronically steerable receive
(Rx) and transmit (Tx) antennas for satellite communications at
Ka-Band are shown. In detail, the integration and packaging
techniques of frontend modules, which combine the antenna, the
RF circuitry, and the cooling system within one functional block,
are discussed. In addition, a novel digital beam steering concept
as well as a hybrid beam steering approach are addressed. It will
be shown that these system concepts can be applied to large
antenna arrays as needed to fulfill link budget requirements for
the intended satellite communications

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents a microstrip antenna array developed for navigation applications. In order to suppress out-of-band interference, the array has been designed to operate in a narrow band. The development of the single element for this array is commented along the paper. Numerical and measured results are presented and discussed

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

In this paper, the analysis of rectangular patches conformed on cylindrical surfaces under the application of the discrete mode matching method (DMM) will be discussed. This technique employs the Green?s function in the spectral domain, which is obtained using a full-wave equivalent circuit (FWEC) that models the layered structure, so that fast and accurate analyses can be performed. In the DMM, the computational domain must be bounded by suitable lateral boundary conditions. For the analysis of microstrip antennas, absorbing boundaries are used that will be described in the final version of this paper. To demonstrate the technique, calculations of the resonance frequencies of patch antennas will be shown. In this case, an eigenvalue problem has to be solved. The radiation pattern at the resonance frequency is also computed. Validations of our results have been done with the cavity model and good agreement between the results obtained with both techniques has been achieved
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract:

In this paper, the analysis of rectangular patches conformed on cylindrical surfaces under the application of the discrete mode matching method (DMM) will be discussed. The radiation pattern at the resonance frequency is also computed. Validations of our results have been done with the cavity model and good agreement between the results obtained with both techniques has been achieved

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

The geometry and numerical results of a dual-band circularly polarized microstrip antenna with two isolated outputs have been presented in this paper. Good return loss has been obtained for both frequency bands. Moreover, a gain response with a strong suppression in the frequency range located between both Galileo bands has been achieved. Due to its high level of integration and high of out-of-band frequencies, this antenna is a good option for the implementation of an array for a Safety-of-Life receiver. Furthermore, the wide radiation pattern of the designed element in both bands allows steering the beam down to low elevation angles, thus making the array capable of receiving signals coming from satellites flying near the horizon
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

To transfer broadband services to mobile users by satellite communication a large bandwidth is required. Since the spectrum at lower frequencies is already densely occupied with different services, free broad frequency bands can be found only at Ka-band or at even higher frequencies. However, in this case a high antenna gain is necessary to compensate for the free-space loss. The user terminal antenna should preferably have low profile so that it can be conveniently mounted on e.g. an aircraft, ship or vehicle

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

In this contribution, the full-wave equivalent circuit (FWEC) and the discrete mode matching (DMM) method are applied to analyze dielectric waveguides and conformal striplines with circular and noncircular cross sections. To demonstrate the techniques, several applications will be shown. Optical fibers with different graded-index profiles are analyzed first. In this case, the variation of the index of refraction is modelled using several homogeneous layers. The second application is the computation of the propagation constants for the two fundamental modes in elliptical dielectric waveguides. Finally, conformal striplines with noncircular top grounds are also analyzed. The comparison of our results with commercial software and with data from other authors shows good agreement
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

To demonstrate the techniques, several applications will be shown. Optical fibers with different graded-index profiles are analyzed first. In this case, the variation of the index of refraction is modelled using several homogeneous layers. The second application is the computation of the propagation constants for the two fundamental modes in elliptical dielectric waveguides. Finally, conformal striplines with noncircular top grounds are also analyzed. The comparison of our results with commercial software and with data from other authors shows good agreement

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents a novel microstrip antenna capable of separating the E5A-E5b and the L1 bands of the European Galileo system in two different isolated ports. With this feature, one 90А-hybrid is needed in each port to receive right-handed circularly polarized (RHCP) waves in each of the aforementioned bands. For this reason, the hybrids can be optimized to operate in the center frequency of each band, hence resulting in an improvement of the axial ratio. Moreover, since the antenna separates already the signals received at each frequency band, the two bands can be processed separately already right after the antenna. Since no diplexer is needed to separate the signals received in the E5a-E5b and L1 bands, volume, weight and cost are reduced in comparison to conventional solutions. In the final version of the paper, the geometrical details of the proposed antenna will be depicted. Simulated and measured results will be shown and discussed. The simulations performed up to now show that the radiation pattern presents nearly the same shape in the two frequency bands of interest. Moreover, due to a proper selection of the employed dielectric materials, the radiation pattern obtained is broad, which is important for receiving the signals coming from satellites passing near the horizon. At the zenith (90А of elevation), the simulations showed that the antenna presents a gain larger than 4 dBi. For an elevation angle of 5А, the computed gain is larger than -5 dBi
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 2009 European Navigation Conference - Global Navigation Satellite Systems - ENC-GNSS 2009

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Radionavegaчуo e Radioastronomia

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: It is well known from the open literature that interference is a serious threat for the new Galileo services especially in the E5 and E6 bands. In particular for the Safety-of?Life (SoL) applications like aviation high power pulsed radars and DMEs are a major concern. To cope with such interference it is essential for the development of a SoL receiver to consider the impact of interference on each part of the receiving chain. For this reason a new project was launched by the Institute of Communications and Navigation of the German Aerospace Center (DLR). The aim of this project is to perform the necessary predevelopment research as well as to develop, build and demonstrate an integrated SoL receiver system, which is robust against interference and multipath effects. Since array antennas with digital beamforming offer a very high potential for suppression of interference and multipath signals, the integration of an array antenna has been included in the receiver design from the early beginning of the project. Some of the most challenging tasks to achieve the project goal include: - Development of antenna elements and arrays optimized for the reception of GPS and Galileo signals - Design of robust front-ends suitable for multi-constellation multi-frequency reception with multiple antennas - Robust and reliable calibration of the full analog receiving chain including antenna and front end - Development and analysis of powerful interference detection and mitigation techniques enhanced for Galileo - Development and analysis of algorithms for providing integrity for SoL applications by receiver autonomous or assisted strategies. The proposed antenna array allows a polarization selective reception as well as adaptive nulling and sidelobe suppression. Through this, the impact of jamming and interference, as well as of multipath can be dramatically reduced

In particular for the Safety-of?Life (SoL) applications like aviation high power pulsed radars and DMEs are a major concern. To cope with such interference it is essential for the development of a SoL receiver to consider the impact of interference on each part of the receiving chain. For this reason a new project was launched by the Institute of Communications and Navigation of the German Aerospace Center (DLR). Some of the most challenging tasks to achieve the project goal include: - Development of antenna elements and arrays optimized for the reception of GPS and Galileo signals - Design of robust front-ends suitable for multi-constellation multi-frequency reception with multiple antennas - Robust and reliable calibration of the full analog receiving chain including antenna and front end - Development and analysis of powerful interference detection and mitigation techniques enhanced for Galileo - Development and analysis of algorithms for providing integrity for SoL applications by receiver autonomous or assisted strategies. The proposed antenna array allows a polarization selective reception as well as adaptive nulling and sidelobe suppression. Through this, the impact of jamming and interference, as well as of multipath can be dramatically reduced

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

The use of spatial-domain signal processing for mitigation of interference signals in receivers of global navigation satellite systems (GNSS) allows for improvement of the overall system performance. To fully benefit from the use of adaptive antenna arrays, the individual signal processing paths in such a multi-antenna system should be thoroughly calibrated. The focus of this paper is on the specifics of such calibration in receivers for satellite navigation systems (e.g. GPS and coming Galileo). The design goals of the antenna and RF front end for GNSS receivers are reviewed. The architecture of a GNSS array receiver for safety-of-life applications with high robustness against radio interference is presented. The practical solutions for the antenna array and RF front-end calibration along with the field test results demonstrating their performance are outlined

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

 This paper presents a concept of a novel Ka-band receiving multibeam antenna that can be used for high-rate data relays between a GEO satellite and several LEO satellites. The antenna is a payload candidate for the German communications satellite Heinrich-Hertz that is intended to be launched in 2014. First numerical results assessing the radiation characteristics and performance of the proposed antenna are given

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract: 

The focus of the paper is on practical aspects of the array calibration in adaptive antennas used in receivers of Global Satellite Navigation Systems (GNSS) for mitigating radio interference and multipath. A model for describing the measurements errors occurring in the receiver when using an adaptive antenna is introduced. The effect of different patterns of the array elements is studied in details. A practical implementation of the adaptive antenna receiver with a real-time calibration capability as well as field test results are presented

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper summarizes the development of safetyof-
life receivers for global navigation satellite systems (GNSS)
that has been being conducted at the Institute of
Communications and Navigation of the German Aerospace
Center (DLR). Two receiver systems have already been
successfully fabricated, integrated and tested by means of field
experiments. Implementation issues of these two systems are
described in this contribution. Details about the third generation
of DLR?s receiving system, which is currently under
development, are also briefly discussed

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper describes a technique known as discrete
mode matching, which is suitable for the full-wave simulation of
conformal microstrip structures. This contribution presents the
theory behind this method, along with the analysis of microstrip
lines and antennas conformed on cylindrical surfaces. The results
have been compared with data obtained using other techniques
and good agreement has been verified

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

For safety critical applications a reliable and precise navigation solution is crucial. It is well known that interference is a serious threat for the new Galileo services especially in the E5 band, as it has already been pointed out in the open literature. Especially for the Safety-of?Life (SoL) applications high power pulsed radars are a major concern.
Therefore it is obvious that for the development of a SoL reveiver the impact of interference on the system has to be considered at each stage of the receiving chain from the single antenna element to the position solution. For this reason a completely new receiver design was necessary, which provides access to each part in the receiver to take appropriate counter measures against almost any kind of interference and jamming

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

Navigation accuracy and integrity demanded by Galileo and its future evolution motivates the study and design of advance receiving techniques. In the context of the Galileo Ground Mission Segment, tracking stations achieving centimetre level tracking accuracy are required to provide the system with accurate satellite ephemeris and clock prediction models [1]. The improvement of the accuracy of the ground station would have an extraordinary impact in the whole system because the same overall system performance could be obtained with less ground stations, thus having a substantial favourable effect of system cost and operations complexity. Similarly, if the number of ground stations is maintained, enhanced stations will have lead to an improved system performance

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Automaчуo Eletrєnica de Processos Elщtricos e Industriais

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

Rice cropping farms are significant loads in power
systems due to the large amount of electrical energy required by
the irrigation system. In Brazil, power companies invest in
research to improve energy efficiency of this type of load. This
paper presents an automated irrigation system based on
supervisory control (SCADA) and wireless communication. The
main objective of the project is to monitor and control the level
of water in the crop, which represents an important impact on
energy efficiency and water consumption. Specific
characteristics of rice cropping irrigation was taken into
account, such as large distances involved and different working
schemes of water pumps. A complete solution is presented and it
includes equipment description for reliable communication and
supervisory features

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: ADIBEAM: Design and experimental validation of a robust beamforming platform for Galileo reference ground stations

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

The increase in navigation accuracy demanded by EGNOS and Galileo and their future evolution encourages the study and design of advance receiver architectures. In that direction, the ADIBEAM project focuses on the design of high accuracy ground stations, specifically GNSS Reference Stations, in order to improve its robustness in front of multipath and interference errors with the goal of achieving centimeter level tracking accuracy. The adoption of antenna arrays and digital beamforming at the ground reference station receivers is one of the most promising approaches to cope with errors induced by multipath and interference. This paper proposes an innovative design of a ground based tracking station. In particular, the architecture proposed is based on the use of an antenna array and digital beamforming techniques, considering both adaptive and deterministic methods. The work carried out here considers the ground based tracking system, including the characterization of the system components (antennas, RF chains, calibration techniques, GNSS software receiver and digital beamforming), and the development of a software based experimentation platform representative of the proposed design for a hardware prototype. The sensitivity to perturbations and the extreme difficulty to perfectly control and calibrate all the components of the system, especially regarding the antenna array implementation, requires that the proposed design take into consideration not only the benefits of the possible solutions but also their feasibility for a real implementation. In summary, this paper will present the design proposed and the Experimentation Platform used for its validation

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo:

O cultivo de arroz representa uma carga significativa aos sistemas de potъncia
devido р grande quantidade de energia elщtrica requerida pelo sistema de irrigaчуo. A
automaчуo щ um recurso que pode melhorar a eficiъncia energщtica, alщm de contribuir na
reduчуo do impacto ambiental da lavoura. Este trabalho apresenta um sistema de irrigaчуo
automatizado para lavouras de arroz, baseado em sistema supervisѓrio e comunicaчуo
sem fio. O objetivo principal do projeto щ monitorar e controlar a lтmina d?сgua na
lavoura, o que representa um impacto importante sobre o consumo de сgua e eletricidade.
Caracterэsticas especэficas da irrigaчуo do arroz foram levadas em consideraчуo, tais
como as grandes distтncias envolvidas e diferentes regimes de trabalho das bombas. A
soluчуo completa щ apresentada e resultados preliminares sуo discutidos
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract:

Rice farms are significant loads to power systems due to the large amount of
electrical energy required by the irrigation system. Automation is a feature that can
improve energy efficiency, and contribute in reducing the environmental impact of
farming. This paper presents an automated irrigation system for rice crops based on
supervisory and wireless communication. The main objective of the project is to monitor
and control the water level in the crop, which is directly related to the consumption of
water and electricity. Specific features of rice irrigation were taken into consideration,
such as the great distances involved and different working schemes of the pumps. The
complete solution is presented and preliminary results are discussed

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Energy saving technology on irrigation system for rice cropping
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Energy saving technology on irrigation system for rice cropping

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 46th International Universities? Power Engineering Conference - UPEC 2011

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Eletrєnica Industrial, Sistemas e Controles Eletrєnicos
AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Automaчуo Eletrєnica de Processos Elщtricos e Industriais

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents a complete solution for the
automated irrigation of rice crops using water level sensors,
remote supervision and wireless communication. The main
objective of the project is to monitor and control the level of
water in the crop, which represents an important impact on
energy efficiency and water consumption. Specific
characteristics of rice cropping irrigation were taken into
account, such as large distances involved and different working
schemes of water pumps. The control of the crop conditions is
done by a dedicated controller, which eliminates the need for a
computer on site. Communication between the controller and
the supervisory system is done through GPRS. The proposed
system has been already implemented in a rice field in South
Brazil. A detailed overview of the proposed automation system
and a discussion of the preliminary results are presented in the
paper

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo: 

Este trabalho apresenta um sistema para controle automatizado da irrigaчуo de lavouras de arroz, baseado em sistema supervisѓrio e comunicaчуo sem fio. A irrigaчуo por inundaчуo realizada atravщs de bombas acionadas por motores elщtricos tem uma parcela significativa no custo de produчуo do arroz, devendo, por isso mesmo, buscar-se sua eficientizaчуo. O objetivo principal do projeto щ o desenvolvimento de um sistema para acionar a estaчуo de bombeamento a partir do monitoramento da lтmina d?сgua na lavoura, o que representa um impacto importante sobre o consumo de сgua e eletricidade. Resultados preliminares mostram uma reduчуo em torno de 85% no consumo de сgua e de 81% no consumo de energia elщtrica, durante um perэodo de testes em uma das parcelas com o sistema automatizado. A soluчуo completa щ apresentada e resultados preliminares sуo discutidos
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract: 

This paper presents a system for automated control of irrigation of rice fields, based on the supervisory system and wireless communication. The flood irrigation carried out by pumps driven by electric motors have a significant share in the cost of rice production, and, therefore, to seek their efficiency. The main objective of the project is to develop a system to drive the pumping station from monitoring the water level in the field, representing a major impact on the consumption of water and electricity. Preliminary results show a reduction of around 85% in water consumption and 81% in electricity consumption during a test period in a parcel with the automated system. The complete solution is presented and preliminary results are discussed

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Discrete mode matching analysis of cylindrical microstrip structures
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Discrete mode matching analysis of cylindrical microstrip structures

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 2011 SBMO/IEEE MTT-S International Microwave and Optoelectronics Conference - IMOC 2011

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents the formulation to apply the
discrete mode matching (DMM) method to analyze microstrip
multilayer structures, such as transmission lines and antennas
conformed to cylinders. The main advantage of the method is
the need of discretization only along the azimuthal and the
axial directions by sampling the fields and current densities
in the interfaces between dielectric layers. The solution in the
radial direction is obtained analytically with the dyadic Green?s
function, which is calculated using the full-wave equivalent circuit
(FWEC) in the spectral domain. The method is used to analyze
two structures: a multilayer conformal transmission line and
a conformal antenna. Validation with the commercial software
HFSS has been done and good agreement between the results
has been observed

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents a complete solution for the
automated irrigation of rice crops using water level sensors,
remote supervision system (SCADA) and wireless
communication (GPRS). The proposed system is tested in four
irrigation areas of small scale (10m x 20m). Ultrasonic sensors
are used to measure the water level in the field. The control of
the crop conditions is done by a dedicated controller, which
eliminates the need for a computer on site. In addition, the
controller has an interface that allows access to its parameters
and also switching over to a standard operation in case of loss
of communication with the supervisory system. The main
result of this work is the efficient use of water and electricity
on the farm

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Anсlise de antenas em fenda anelar com polarizaчуo circular

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 15К SBMO - Simpѓsio Brasileiro de Micro-ondas e Optoeletrєnica e o 10К CBMag - Congresso Brasileiro de Eletromagnetismo

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo:

Este artigo apresenta o estudo da geometria antena em
fenda anelar circularmente polarizada para recepчуo de sinais do
sistema de posicionamento global ? GPS. O irradiador щ
projetado com a utilizaчуo do pacote comercial Ansoft Designer.
O projeto da antena para operaчуo na banda L1 do sistema GPS
щ descrito e resultados numщricos para os principais parтmetros
da antena sуo apresentados. Com apenas um laminado de microondas
e uma camada de ar, foi possэvel projetar uma antena com
boa razуo axial. Alщm de apresentar construчуo simples, a antena
projetada possui alta robustez a tolerтncias do processo de
construчуo

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Estudo da influъncia do acoplamento mњtuo sobre a razуo axial em redes de antenas com polarizaчуo circular

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 15К SBMO - Simpѓsio Brasileiro de Micro-ondas e Optoeletrєnica e o 10К CBMag - Congresso Brasileiro de Eletromagnetismo

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo:

Este trabalho apresenta o estudo de duas topologias de antenas em microfita circularmente polarizadas, bem como a anсlise dos efeitos causados pelo acoplamento mњtuo sobre a razуo axial de redes de antenas lineares e planares. Foi observado que o acoplamento mњtuo altera significativamente os resultados em termos de razуo axial e frequъncia de antenas de polarizaчуo circular com geometria quadrada de cantos truncados. Jс em antenas quadradas com dois pontos de alimentaчуo foi observada maior imunidade ao acoplamento mњtuo. Atravщs de simulaчѕes utilizando o Ansoft Designer, pєde-se observar estes efeitos para diversas redes de antenas com diferentes dimensѕes, onde percebeu-se que a variaчуo na razуo axial e o deslocamento em frequъncia tendem a diminuir р medida em que o nњmero de elementos da rede щ aumentado. Foi observado que a otimizaчуo da razуo axial pode ser realizada tomando-se apenas um pequeno nњmero de elementos para realizar o projeto de redes de grande porte. Como consequъncia, reduz-se o tempo de simulaчуo para o ajuste da razуo axial e frequъncia central de operaчуo de redes com grandes dimensѕes

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Projeto de antenas de microfita de baixo custo e alto ganho para sistemas de comunicaчуo sem fio

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 15К SBMO - Simpѓsio Brasileiro de Micro-ondas e Optoeletrєnica e o 10К CBMag - Congresso Brasileiro de Eletromagnetismo

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo:

Este trabalho apresenta o projeto de duas topologias de irradiadores de microfita de baixo custo. Os dois modelos de antena apresentam polarizaчуo linear e operam na frequъncia de 2,4 GHz. Para reduzir o custo de produчуo, as antenas foram projetadas utilizando-se laminados de FR4. A estratщgia completa de projeto щ apresentada e os resultados sуo discutidos. Protѓtipos das duas antenas foram construэdos com o objetivo de validar os resultados teѓricos. Os resultados medidos para impedтncia de entrada apresentam concordтncia muito boa em comparaчуo рs curvas obtidas com pacotes comerciais de anсlise eletromagnщtica. Mesmo utilizando um laminado de FR4 para o projeto, resultados numщricos apontam que a geometria otimizada apresentou ganho estimado de 8,4 dBi

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Estudo de antenas em fenda anelar para sistemas de navegaчуo via satщlite

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XXX Simpѓsio Brasileiro de Telecomunicaчѕes - SBrT 2012

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo:

Este artigo apresenta o estudo de uma antena com geometria do tipo fenda anelar para sistemas de navegaчуo global via satщlite. Com o auxэlio de resultados numщricos, os principais parтmetros de projeto sуo analisados. O procedimento de otimizaчуo das redes de casamento para ajuste da impedтncia de entrada do irradiador щ descrita. Finalmente, um acoplador hэbrido de 90А щ conectado рs saэdas da antena para possibilitar recepчуo de ondas circularmente polarizadas р direita. Com apenas um laminado de micro-ondas, foi possэvel projetar uma antena circularmente polarizada com um acoplador hэbrido integrado, o que resulta em um processo de construчуo extremamente simples e com baixo custo
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract:

This paper describes the analysis of an annular-slot
antenna for global navigation satellite systems. The main design
parameters are analyzed and numerical results are shown. The
optimizations performed for the impedance matching networks
are described. Finally, a 90А-hybrid is integrated to the antenna
outputs, so as to allow reception of right-handed circularly
polarized waves. The design of this radiator was possible by
employing only one dielectric layer for both slot-ring antenna
and the feeding lines. This yielded an optimized geometry that is
low-cost and easy to fabricate

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Ferramenta computacional para projeto e anсlise rсpida de antenas de microfita simples

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XXX Simpѓsio Brasileiro de Telecomunicaчѕes - SBrT 2012

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo:

Este artigo apresenta os resultados obtidos com um cѓdigo desenvolvido em ambiente MATLAB para anсlise e projeto de antenas de microfita simples. O cѓdigo em questуo modela antenas retangulares alimentadas via prova coaxial utilizando os modelos da linha de transmissуo e cavidade ressonante. O programa desenvolvido foi validado atravщs da comparaчуo de resultados com o pacote comercial de anсlise eletromagnщtica Ansoft Designer, sendo possэvel verificar excelente concordтncia entre os resultados obtidos
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract:

This paper presents the results obtained with a code developed in MATLAB environment to analyze and design planar rectangular microstrip antennas. The code is based on the transmission line and on the cavity models applied to probe-fed antennas with rectangular shape. Validation was performed by comparison of results with the commercial electromagnetic simulator Ansoft Designer and excellent agreement between results has been verified

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Ferramenta computacional para anсlise de antenas filamentares utilizando o mщtodo dos momentos

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XXX Simpѓsio Brasileiro de Telecomunicaчѕes - SBrT 2012

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo:

Este trabalho apresenta a construчуo de uma ferramenta computacional, que realiza o cсlculo da distribuiчуo
de corrente em antenas filamentares utilizando o Mщtodo dos Momentos. Para tanto, foram utilizadas diferentes abordagens: o Point-Matching e o Mщtodo de Galerkin. Ambas foram implementadas em ambiente Matlab R . Para demonstrar o uso da ferramenta, um dipolo de meia-onda foi analisado considerando-se diferentes tipos de funчѕes base. Em termos de diagrama de irradiaчуo, verificou-se que a escolha da funчуo base nуo afeta os resultados de forma significativa. Um estudo da convergъncia do MoM para o cсlculo da impedтncia de entrada de um dipolo de meia-onda foi realizado, no qual foi possэvel verificar que todas as curvas tendem para o mesmo valor quando a discretizaчуo do dipolo щ aumentada, independentemente da funчуo base adotada
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract:

This paper presents the implementation of a computational
tool that performs the calculation of the current
distribution in wire antennas using the Method of Moments
(MoM). For this purpose, different approaches were used: the
Point-Matching Method and the Galerkin Method. Both were
implemented in Matlab R
 . To demonstrate the use of the tool, a
half-wavelength dipole has been analyzed considering different
basis functions. In terms of radiation pattern, it was observed that
the kind of basis function does not affect the results significantly.
The convergence of the MoM for the computation of input
impedance has been studied. It has been verified that all the
curves approach the same value as the discretization is increased
regardless of which basis function is employed in the calculations

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Anсlise de dipolos e antenas Yagi-Uda utilizando o mщtodo dos momentos

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Anсlise de dipolos e antenas Yagi-Uda utilizando o mщtodo dos momentos

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IV Salуo Internacional de Ensino Pesquisa e Extensуo

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo:

Este artigo descreve a proposta, e alguns resultados jс adquiridos da pesquisa que serс realizada na сrea de antenas, que visa ao projeto de uma nova geometria de antena em tecnologia de microfita. O objetivo щ estudar diferentes antenas dupla-faixa que satisfaчam especificaчѕes para operaчуo em rсdio-base para telefonia mѓvel celular. As antenas de microfita tornaram-se muito populares na dщcada de 1970, principalmente em aplicaчѕes espaciais, pois sуo simples, de baixo custo de fabricaчуo utilizando tecnologia de circuitos impressos, sуo mecanicamente robustas e podem ser montadas em aeronaves, mэsseis, satщlites ou outros veэculos

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Ferramenta computacional para anсlise de dipolos e antenas Yagi-Uda utilizando o mщtodo dos momentos

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IV Salуo Internacional de Ensino Pesquisa e Extensуo

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo:

O presente trabalho tem por objetivo apresentar a construчуo de uma ferramenta computacional que realiza o cсlculo da distribuiчуo de corrente em antenas filamentares utilizando o mщtodo dos momentos. A partir da distribuiчуo de corrente obtida, calculam-se as caracterэsticas de irradiaчуo da antena, tais como diagrama de irradiaчуo e impedтncia de entrada. De forma a construir a ferramenta, definiu-se previamente o campo elщtrico incidente, a funчуo Kernel e as funчѕes base. Utilizaram-se os modelos Delta-Gap e Gerador Magnetic-Frill para a definiчуo do campo elщtrico incidente

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Ferramenta computacional para projeto e anсlise rсpida de antenas de microfita simples

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo:

O presente trabalho visa ao estudo de mщtodos numщricos rсpidos para a anсlise e o projeto de geometrias simples. As antenas de microfita podem ser sintetizadas e analisadas utilizando-se vсrias tщcnicas numщricas. As mais simples e rсpidas sуo: Mщtodo da Linha de Transmissуo (LT) e Cavidade Ressonante. A fim de possibilitar uma rсpida sэntese de antenas de microfita simples, um programa foi desenvolvido em ambiente MATLAB para obter as dimensѕes iniciais de elementos irradiadores

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Mщtodo numщrico para o cсlculo da diretividade em ambiente MATLAB

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo:

Este trabalho tem como objetivo estudar e codificar um mщtodo de cсlculo da diretividade em ambiente MATLAB. A validaчуo do cѓdigo serс dada atravщs da resoluчуo de um exemplo conhecido, comparando-se o valor obtido para diretividade com o resultado analэtico. A diretividade basicamente щ a razуo entre a intensidade de radiaчуo em uma determinada direчуo pela intensidade de radiaчуo total fornecida pela fonte. A potъncia irradiada, necessсria para o cсlculo da diretividade, pode ser determinada pela integraчуo das funчѕes de campo. A integraчуo pode ser aproximada numericamente por uma sщrie dada pela multiplicaчуo de dois somatѓrios em funчуo dos тngulos theta e phi e posterior divisуo dos intervalos angulares em N e M segmentos em theta e phi, respectivamente

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Design of circularly polarized annular slot antennas for satellite navigation systems
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Design of circularly polarized annular slot antennas for satellite navigation systems

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 7th European Conference on Antennas and Propagation - EuCAP 2013

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents the study of two different
circularly polarized annular slot antennas designed for the global
positioning system (GPS). The antennas are designed for the
operation in the L1-band. The design procedure is briefly
described. Numerical results show that both antennas present
good performance in terms of impedance matching and circular
polarization purity. In comparison to other geometries found in
the literature, one of the topologies discussed in this contribution
exhibits high robustness against fabrication tolerances. It should
be pointed out that both proposed antennas can be constructed
by using only one layer of microwave laminate, hence yielding
low-cost solutions for high precision GPS-based navigation
systems

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Fast analysis of flush-mounted cylindrical microstrip structures
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Fast analysis of flush-mounted cylindrical microstrip structures

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 7th European Conference on Antennas and Propagation - EuCAP 2013

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents the application of the discrete
mode matching (DMM) method to analyze microstrip lines and
antennas flush-mounted on cylindrical substrates. The DMM is
well suited to the analysis of multilayered structures, since the
fields must be calculated only at the interfaces between the dielectric
layers, so that merely a one-dimensional discretization is
needed to analyze cylindrical microstrip structures. The analysis
is based on the Green?s function in the spectral domain, which
is calculated by using a full-wave equivalent circuit. In order to
demonstrate the method, two structures are analyzed: a singlylayered
conformal microstrip antenna, and a microstrip line
printed on a cylindrical substrate composed of multiple dielectric layers
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 2013 IEEE AP-S International Symposium

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents the application of optimization
methods for the synthesis of a linear array for radio base stations
of mobile communications systems. The desired pattern shall
exhibit squared-cosecant shape, so as to provide uniform
distribution of power inside the base station cell and to reduce cochannel
interference. The synthesis is performed by a
combination of optimization methods: the genetic algorithm is
used for the initial global search, then the sequential quadratic
programming is applied for local search. This approach allows
faster convergence than using only one kind of optimization
method. The technique is demonstrated for a linear array of
isotropic elements and, subsequently, for an array of microstrip
antennas
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents the design of a printed antenna with annular slot geometry for GNSS applications. Two prototypes were built in order to meet the requirements of these systems. Different feeding techniques have been proposed in order to obtain the right-hand circular polarization. Electrical walls were added in the prototypes to avoid losses by parallel plate modes, to improve the radiation efficiency, gain and axial ratio. The proposed geometries were designed and built with two different feeding schemes: the first one is based on a series feed, whereas the other is based on the integration of a 90К-hybrid .The results showed that the synthesized antenna has all features required to operate in the Global Navigation Satellite Systems (GNSS)
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
