INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents the application of optimization
methods for the synthesis of a linear array to operate in the
frequency range of 4G technology in Brazil. The desired pattern
shall exhibit squared-cosecant shape, so as to provide uniform
distribution of power inside the base station cell and to reduce cochannel
interference. Such an array is well suited to operate as a
radio base station of mobile communications systems. The
synthesis is performed by a combination of optimization
methods: the genetic algorithm, which is used for the initial
global search, and the sequential quadratic programming, which
is applied for local refinement of the solution. This approach
allows faster convergence than using only one kind of
optimization method. The technique is demonstrated for a linear
array of isotropic elements and, subsequently, for an array of Eshaped microstrip antennas

array of isotropic elements and, subsequently, for an array of Eshaped microstrip antennas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo:

Este artigo apresenta a aplicaчуo de mщtodos de otimizaчуo para a sэntese de uma rede linear que opere na faixa de frequъncia da tecnologia 4G no Brasil. O diagrama especificado apresenta o formato de cossecante ao quadrado, visando р obtenчуo de distribuiчуo uniforme de potъncia dentro de uma cщlula e a reduчуo da interferъncia co-canal com outras cщlulas nas proximidades. A sэntese щ realizada a partir da combinaчуo de dois mщtodos de otimizaчуo: algoritmo genщtico, para a execuчуo de uma busca global, e programaчуo quadrсtica sequencial, para refinamento local da soluчуo. A combinaчуo de ambas as tщcnicas permite uma convergъncia mais rсpida se comparada р utilizaчуo de apenas um mщtodo de otimizaчуo. O procedimento de sэntese щ demonstrado para uma rede linear de elementos isotrѓpicos e, em seguida, para uma rede de antenas com formato E em tecnologia de microfita
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract:

This paper presents the application of optimization methods for the synthesis of a linear array to operate in the frequency range allocated for the 4G technology in Brazil. The desired pattern shall exhibit squared-cosecant shape in order to provide uniform distribution of power inside the base station cell and to reduce co-channel interference. The synthesis is performed by a combination of optimization methods: the genetic algorithm, which is used for the initial global search, and the sequential quadratic programming, which is applied for local refinement of the solution. This approach allows faster convergence than using only one kind of optimization method. The synthesis is demonstrated considering initially a linear array of isotropic elements and, subsequently, for an array of E-shaped microstrip antennas

Resumo:

Este artigo apresenta o estudo e projeto de antenas de microfita com geometria em fenda anelar para aplicaчѕes em sistemas de navegaчуo via satщlite. Duas estruturas sуo propostas contendo uma fenda anelar construэda sobre um laminado de micro-ondas e alimentaчуo em sщrie ou atravщs de um acoplador hэbrido de 90А na parte inferior. Atravщs dos resultados obtidos com ferramentas computacionais e protѓtipos, pєde-se obter uma antena com polarizaчуo circular р direita, ampla largura de banda, diagrama de irradiaчуo quase hemisfщrico e pureza de polarizaчуo satisfatѓria para a aplicaчуo desejada
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract:

This paper presents the study and design of annular slot antennas for satellite navigation systems. Two structures are analyzed: one structure has a series feed scheme, whereas the other is composed of an integrated 90А hybrid coupler. One of the designed antennas exhibits right-hand circular polarization, wide bandwidth, wide half-power beamwidth and acceptable polarization purity for the desired application. These characteristics are demonstrated by theoretical and experimental results

Este trabalho aborda o desenvolvimento de uma ferramenta computacional para a anсlise de redes de antenas, demonstrando as caracterэsticas gerais de antenas, o modo como o cѓdigo foi programado e os mщtodos utilizados para calcular os diagramas de irradiaчуo e a diretividade de redes lineares de antenas dipolo e de microfita. Resumo:

Este artigo apresenta uma anсlise de convergъncia na obtenчуo da constante de propagaчуo de estruturas planares de microfita utilizando o Mщtodo do Casamento Discreto de Modos. Para tanto, uma ferramenta computacional foi implementada em ambiente MatlabЎ, com a qual foram realizadas simulaчѕes. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Hybrid method uses RSS and AoA to establish a low-cost localization system
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Hybrid method uses RSS and AoA to establish a low-cost localization system

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 4th Argentine Symposium and Conference on Embedded Systems - SASE/CASE 2013

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

The present paper proposes a method to implement a
low-cost Localization System (LS) in a wireless sensor network
(WSN) in open field. This method is based on RSS to obtain
distance and angle values. Also this values are used to compute
the position of the desired object, proposing the Localization by
one Point (LboP) method. Although RSS values suffer alterations
from different sources, in this paper several tests are performed
in order to determine them and establish the limits. A prototype
was developed enabling to run the necessary field tests.
Preliminary results shows that is possible to measure distance
and angle based on RSS values, but some concern must be taken
to enable the system operation with a reliable performance

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Dual-band annular slot antenna for radio base stations
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Dual-band annular slot antenna for radio base stations

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 8th European Conference on Antennas and Propagation - EuCAP 2014

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents the study and design of a dualband
linearly polarized annular slot antenna. The proposed
antenna is designed for operation in the lower (0.824 ?
0.960 GHz) and in the higher bands (1.710 ? 2.165 GHz) of the
Brazilian mobile communications system. The antenna is
designed considering one output for each frequency band, so that
both bands can be processed independently. Numerical results
show that the antenna exhibits good performance in terms of
return loss and radiation pattern in both bands. The proposed
geometry has been manufactured and the experimental results
are compared to numerical data. A parametric analysis for some
antenna parameters is shown and the results discussed

Abstract:

This paper presents the study of microstrip antenna
arrays for meteorological nano-satellites that are under
development in the frame of UNIESPAЧO programme, which
is supported by the Brazilian Space Agency (AEB). The main
goal of such satellites is to serve as data relay for transmission
of meteorological data collected by stations deployed in remote
areas, such as in the rain forest, whereby no wired communication
is possible. Arrays composed of linearly and circularly polarized
microstrip antennas are investigated. The performance of such
arrays is assessed including parameter variations, especially for
the case of dielectric constant of the antenna substrate and
misalignment in the orientation of the array elements. Such
imperfections can occur due to mechanical stress and large
temperature variations that are typical to the space environment.
The antennas were modeled with the electromagnetic simulator
Ansys HFSS. Good results have been observed in terms of the
axial ratio, impedance bandwidth and gain for both of the
proposed models

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Optimization of switched-beam arrays for communication systems
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Optimization of switched-beam arrays for communication systems

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: The Eleventh International Symposium on Wireless Communication Systems - ISWCS 2014

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents the application of optimization
methods for the synthesis of a linear array for communication
systems. By means of suitably beam switching, the array should
provide coverage of a given angular area in azimuth and should
allow controlling the sidelobe level simultaneously. For this
purpose, two optimization methods have been used to calculate
the excitation coefficient for each desired beam. The synthesis
technique is demonstrated for arrays composed of isotropic and
microstrip elements. By comparing the results obtained for both
arrays, the need of consideration of the array element pattern
during the synthesis process is demonstrated

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo:

Este artigo apresenta diferentes aspectos da aplicaчуo de mщtodos para conformaчуo de feixe e controle dos lѓbulos secundсrios. Os diagramas sуo sintetizados a partir da combinaчуo de tщcnicas clсssicas de conformaчуo de feixe, tais como transformada de Fourier e de Woodward-Lawson, com a programaчуo quadrсtica sequencial. Os mщtodos clсssicos apresentam limitaчуo referente ao controle dos lѓbulos laterais, porщm podem ser utilizados para a obtenчуo de um vetor de corrente de excitaчуo para a inicializaчуo da programaчуo quadrсtica sequencial. Esta њltima permite a convergъncia para garantir que os coeficientes calculados reproduzam um diagrama que atenda рs especificaчѕes de projeto (direчуo de apontamento e nэvel dos lѓbulos secundсrios). Inicialmente, a partir da combinaчуo das tщcnicas citadas, a sэntese de uma rede com 8 elementos isotrѓpicos щ realizada. Em seguida, a ferramenta щ aplicada para a sэntese de uma rede de antenas de microfita

Resumo:

Esse trabalho apresenta o projeto de uma antena de baixo custo concebida a partir de uma lata de cerveja
cilэndrica. A principal especificaчуo para a antena щ a frequъncia de operaчуo em 2,4 GHz, que щ a para WLAN. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents the applicattion of optimization methods for the synthesis of antenna arrays. The desired pattern shall exhibit a shape that allows uniform distribution of the radiated power on the Earth. Besides beamshaping, the optimization methods allow controlling the level of the sidelobes. The synthesis technique is used to calculate the excitation coefficients for arrays composed of cavity-backed circularly polarized annular slot antennas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract: 

This paper presents the study of microstrip antenna arrays for meteorological
nano-satellites that are under development in the frame of
UNIESPAЧO programme, which is supported by the Brazilian Space Agency
(AEB). The main goal of such satellites is to serve as data relay for
transmission of meteorological data collected by stations deployed in remote
areas, such as in the rain forest, whereby no wired communication is possible.
Arrays composed of circularly polarized microstrip antennas are investigated.
The performance of this array is assessed including parameter variations,
especially for the case of dielectric constant of the antenna substrate
and misalignment in the orientation of the array elements. Such imperfections
can occur due to mechanical stress and large temperature variations
that are typical to the space environment. Finally, a discussion on the design
of the feeding system to generate circular polarization with the designed array
is presented. The antennas were modeled with the electromagnetic simulator
Ansys HFSS. Good performance has been observed in terms of axial
ratio, impedance bandwidth and gain for the proposed model

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents the design of a dual-band microstrip antenna with dual polarization characteristic for high altitude platforms (HAPs). The antenna has two isolated ports and is suitable for terminals with receiving and transmitting functions operating simultaneously. The element is designed for operation at 5.8 and 7 GHz with 100 MHz bandwidth in each band. The antenna geometry and its main design parameters are presented and discussed in the paper. Numerical and experimental results show that this radiator exhibits good performance in terms of impedance matching and circular polarization purity
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract:

This paper presents the design of a dual-band microstrip antenna with dual polarization characteristic for high altitude platforms (HAPs). The antenna has two isolated ports and is suitable for terminals with receiving and transmitting functions operating simultaneously. The element is designed for operation at 5.8 and 7 GHz with 100 MHz bandwidth in each band. The antenna geometry and its main design parameters are presented and discussed in the paper. Numerical and experimental results show that this radiator exhibits good performance in terms of impedance matching and circular polarization purity

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Beamforming of an E-shaped linear array for WLAN systems applying PSO algorithm with restrictive approach
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Beamforming of an E-shaped linear array for WLAN systems applying PSO algorithm with restrictive approach

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XXXIII Simpѓsio Brasileiro de Telecomunicaчѕes - SBrT 2015

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents a four-element linear array
composed of E-shaped microstrip antennas designed to switchedbeam
application in WLAN systems. Particle Swarm Optimization
(PSO) algorithm is applied to optimize the amplitude of the
excitation currents applied to each array radiator aiming to yield
four distinct beams with 25 dB suppression of sidelobes. For this
application, it has been verified the necessity of a constraint of
power applied to each radiator in the PSO optimization in order
to improve the algorithm convergence and to achieve only feasible
solutions which satisfy the imposed constraints
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract:

This paper presents a four-element linear array
composed of E-shaped microstrip antennas designed to switchedbeam
application in WLAN systems. Particle Swarm Optimization

four distinct beams with 25 dB suppression of sidelobes. For this
application, it has been verified the necessity of a constraint of
power applied to each radiator in the PSO optimization in order
to improve the algorithm convergence and to achieve only feasible
solutions which satisfy the imposed constraints

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Microstrip antenna with extended ground plane for meteorological nano-satellites
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Microstrip antenna with extended ground plane for meteorological nano-satellites

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XXXIII Simpѓsio Brasileiro de Telecomunicaчѕes - SBrT 2015

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents the study of a microstrip
antenna to be installed onto meteorological nano-satellites. In
order to increase the effective ground plane and to optimize the
decoupling between the main and the cross polarizations, metallic
strips were attached to the antenna ground plane. The antenna
performance was evaluated using different types and sizes of
metallic strips. An improvement in the front-to-back ratio whilst
keeping good axial ratio performance was observed
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Synthesis of the radiation pattern of retrodirective antenna arrays using the particle swarm optimization algorithm
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Synthesis of the radiation pattern of retrodirective antenna arrays using the particle swarm optimization algorithm

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 2015 SBMO/IEEE MTT-S International Microwave and Optoelectronics Conference - IMOC 2015

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract: This paper presents a study of radiation pattern
synthesis for retrodirective arrays for mobile communication
services in a scenario using high altitude platforms (HAPs).
For this purpose, a dual-band and dual-polarization microstrip
antenna array has been designed, whereby the array should
receive the signal in one band and resend it in the other
operating band. The radiation pattern in the receiving mode has
been synthesized with the Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO)
algorithm, which allowed steering the main beam and controlling
the side lobe level. In order to assess the performance for
practical implementation, a study on the impact of the magnitude
discretization due to the use of digitally controlled variable-gain
amplifiers on the radiation properties of the array in receiving
mode was carried out. The results show that the performance is
slightly affected by limitations on the RF circuitry for practical
implementation

methods to synthesize the radiation pattern of linear antenna

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Antena de microfita com plano de terra estendido

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: VII Salуo Internacional de Ensino, Pesquisa e Extensуo

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Resumo: Este trabalho apresenta o estudo de uma antena de microfita com plano de terra (GND) estendido, para a coleta de dados ambientais na faixa de UHF, como colaboraчуo ao Projeto CONASAT. Para aumentar o GND efetivo e aperfeiчoar a relaчуo frente-costas da antena, foram fixadas fitas metсlicas ao GND. As antenas foram projetadas no software de simulaчуo Ansoft HFSSЎ (High Frequency Structure Simulator), e o desempenho das antenas foi avaliado utilizando dois modelos geomщtricos diferentes de fitas. Com a utilizaчуo de fitas metсlicas, o ganho da antena melhorou 1,3 dBi, o que resultou em um aumento de 12 dB no resultado da razуo frente-costas em relaчуo р antena de microfita tradicional. Estes resultados representam uma grande melhora no desempenho da antena com pouco aumento no volume e peso

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Desenvolvimento de uma ferramenta computacional para sэntese de redes de antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Resumo: Neste trabalho щ apresentado o desenvolvimento de uma ferramenta computacional baseada no algoritmo de otimizaчуo por enxame de partэculas (PSO) para sintetizar diagramas de irradiaчуo de redes lineares de antenas. A sэntese tem como objetivo determinar as correntes (amplitudes e fases) de alimentaчуo dos elementos que compѕem a rede. As correntes calculadas devem produzir um diagrama de irradiaчуo que atinge as especificaчѕes de projeto. Neste trabalho, a ferramenta foi desenvolvida no software Matlab, e permite realizar o apontamento do feixe em uma determinada direчуo, alщm de controlar o nэvel dos lѓbulos laterais. Essa tщcnica foi aplicada em uma rede linear de elementos isotrѓpicos e tem um tempo aproximado de execuчуo do cѓdigo de 3,98 segundos

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Antena de microfita com alimentaчуo por acoplamento por aberturas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo: As antenas em tecnologia de microfita sуo basicamente linhas de transmissуo nуo balanceadas, alargadas
fisicamente e separadas por um material isolante, onde um dos condutores serve como referencial ou terra. Essas
antenas sуo conhecidas como patch e sуo impressas em diversas geometrias, podendo ser de forma circular,
retangular, quadrada, triangular e atщ apresentar forma periѓdica ou fractal. Hс diversos mщtodos de alimetaчуo.
Entretanto, o mщtodo por acoplamento eletromagnщtico por abertura proporciona maior isolamento entre a linha de
alimentaчуo e o elemento irradiador. Assim, diminui-se a interferъncia eletromagnщtica devido р irradiaчуo espњria
proveniente da alimentaчуo, de forma a aumentar a pureza de polarizaчуo e a nуo degradar o diagrama de irradiaчуo
da antena. O objetivo deste trabalho foi o estudo e projeto de uma antena em tecnologia de microfita que operasse em
banda S. Sendo que a primeira estrutura do protѓtipo foi simulada no software ANSYS HFSS e apresentou bons
resultados, os quais serуo discutidos neste artigo

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Eletromagnetic analysis of installed performance of antennas integrated onto nano-satellites
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Eletromagnetic analysis of installed performance of antennas integrated onto nano-satellites

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 2nd IAA Latin American CubeSat Workshop

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract: In this paper, the performance of antennas installed onto meteorological nano-satellites
is investigated. The size of the modeled nano-sat is 8U, with four articulated flaps, which
are intended to increase the total area for installation of solar panels. The nano-sat is
to serve as a data relay for the Brazilian Meteorological Data Collecting System. The
antennas investigated in this contribution are related to telemetry, telecommand and
data transmission (uplink and downlink). The study of the performance of the array
antennas began with the electromagnetic simulation of the telemetry and telecommand
structures. In order to investigate the installed performance under the influence of the
nano-sat structure, two scenarios were simulated: with and without articulated flaps.
The calculated gain values for the telecommand antennas were -0.44 dBi and 3.33 dBi
with and without articulated flaps, respectively. The comparison of results shows that
the presence of articulated flaps influences significantly the operation of the telecommand
antennas. For the telemetry antennas, the gain values obtained way simulations were
2.93 dBi and 1.58 dBi with and without articulated flaps, respectively. By increasing
the number of monopoles to 4, gain increases to 3.32 dBi and 1.75 dBi with and without
articulated flaps, respectively. Thus, for case of the telemetry antennas, an improvement
in the performance with four monopoles and with the presence of the articulated flaps
has been verified

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: On the discretization for the discrete mode matching method for conformal microstrip structures
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: On the discretization for the discrete mode matching method for conformal microstrip structures

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 10th European Conference on Antennas and Propagation - EuCAP 2016

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract: 

This paper presents the analysis of cylinderconformal
microstrip lines and resonators with the discrete mode
matching method. The focus of the analyses is the assessment of
the accuracy of the results by using different discretization
schemes on the metallizations. From the theoretical results, it
becomes clear that the use of a suitable discretization scheme can
provide highly accurate results with the use of only very few
discretization lines, hence reducing simulation time and needed
computer resources. The results are validated by comparison
with measured data found in the literature and with numerical
data calculated with ANSYS HFSS
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 10th European Conference on Antennas and Propagation - EuCAP 2016

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

?This paper compares the performance of
beamforming techniques applied to linear microstrip arrays
under normal operation and for the case of faulty elements. The
techniques are compared in terms of viability of implementation
in embedded systems, such as an FPGA development board, and
in terms of beamforming performance. The pattern
optimizations considered aimed at steering the main beam,
controlling the side lobe level and maximizing directivity. After
numerical investigations, it is demonstrated that satisfactory
results are obtained by both techniques for small steering angles
(up to 30К). The pattern deterioration in case of failure of one
element cannot be fully compensated, but both optimization
techniques are able to improve radiation performance significantly

Os mщtodos clсssicos apresentam limitaчуo referente ao controle dos lѓbulos laterais. Assim sendo, faz-se necessсria a utilizaчуo de outras tщcnicas para determinaчуo das correntes de excitaчуo para os elementos que compѕem a rede. Neste trabalho, os diagramas de irradiaчуo sуo sintetizados a partir do mщtodo de otimizaчуo por colєnia de formigas, que permite controlar o nэvel dos lѓbulos laterais e, consequentemente, reduzir a irradiaчуo de potъncia para direчѕes indesejadas. A partir da tщcnica citada, a sэntese de uma rede com 10 elementos isotrѓpicos щ realizada para diferentes direчѕes de apontament

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: This paper describes the development of an electromagnetic simulation procedure for radio frequency (RF) printed circuit boards (PCBs) using ANSYS Electronics Desktop (AEDT) for simulation. The main goal of this work is to convert and to obtain an simulation model of a PCB layout software for electromagnetic simulations. The deﬁned application of such circuit is to be employed as front-ends for retrodirective systems. To validate the proposed technique, two RF circuits composed of low-noise ampliﬁer and medium-power ampliﬁer were designed, manufactured and measured. Simulated and measured results in terms of reﬂection and transmission coefﬁcients were compared and good agreement was observed

A solucИ?ao dada pelo mДetodo Dolph-Chebyshev funciona como um ponto de partida para o algoritmo PSO. A aplicacИ?ao do mДetodo reduz o nДumero de iteracИ?oes necessДarias para se alcancИar a solucИ?ao e aumenta a taxa de converg?encia bem-sucedida em todos os casos avaliados
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract: This article presents a hybrid optimization method combining Dolph-Chebyshev array design and Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO) applied on beamforming synthesis for a linear antenna array. The weight coefﬁcients given by Chebyshev polynomial allocates a particle closer to global minimum on PSO space of solutions. This approach successfully reduces the number of iteration required to complete the optimization and also improves the convergence success ratio

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 2017 SBMO/IEEE MTT-S International Microwave and Optoelectronics Conference - IMOC 2017

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

In this paper, we present a radio frequency (RF)
transmitter front-end that can be used in analog beamforming
applications. The proposed system is modular and can be
employed at different frequencies whereby C-band operation is
shown. Using low-cost components and substrates, this design
makes analog beamforming affordable also for commercial applications
with unit costs below 130e and expected overall gain of
11.1 dB. We demonstrate the system performance in terms of Sparameter
measurements with frequency translation to 7.0 GHz.
Reproducibility of the achieved results is shown by analyzing
multiple front-end prototypes. The beamforming capability is
verified by antenna pattern measurements with an eight-element
array
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

multiple front-end prototypes. The beamforming capability is
verified by antenna pattern measurements with an eight-element
array

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Analysis of Dual-Band Non-Uniformly spaced arrays for mobile communications

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 2017 SBMO/IEEE MTT-S International Microwave and Optoelectronics Conference - IMOC 2017

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents an analysis of a dual-band array
for base stations of mobile communication systems. The main
challenge is to suppress grating lobes for interelement spacings
equal or larger than the wavelength. In order to achieve this
result, particle swarm optimization (PSO) is used to find the
optimum excitation coefficients (amplitudes and phases) and
the non-uniform spacing between elements of the array. The
suppression of grating lobes is shown by comparisons with results
obtained with a standard uniform linear array for two cases:
standard beam pointing to the boresight, and main beam with
squared cosecant shape. The use of non-uniform spaced arrays
allowed reducing grating lobes in comparison to a standard
uniform array
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

This paper presents an analysis of a dual-band array

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

In this paper, the design of an aperture-coupled microstrip
antenna to be installed onto a nano-satellite is described.
The proposed antenna has been optimized to operate at 2.26 GHz
(S-Band), which is the operating frequency of the downlink channel
of the Brazilian System for Meteorological Data Acquisition.
The electromagnetic analysis is done by using HFSS software.
For the design validation, prototypes were manufactured and
the comparison between simulations and measurements indicates
good performance of the proposed antenna

This paper describes a circularly polarized 2x2 microstrip antenna array for operating at K-Band
(18.95 GHz), more precisely in the frequency range 18.7-19.2GHz, to be used as a feed of a
satellite communications reflectarray antenna. The proposed configuration is based on the wellknown
microstrip square patch with two truncated corners fed by a microstrip line quarter wave
transformer

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

In this paper, the design of a cylindrical dielectric
resonator antenna (CDRA) operating at 401 MHz is presented.
The proposed antenna has been optimized for the uplink channel
of the Brazilian System for Meteorological Data Acquisition. Two
CDRA models have been analyzed: the first model is a standard
cylindrical dielectric resonator, whereas the second topology has
a copper plate that loads the top of the dielectric cylinder.
The latter yielded a reduction of 37.5% in terms of volume
in comparison to the former. The designed antenna exhibits
electrical features suitable for installation onto nano-satellite
platforms

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo:

Neste trabalho, a influъncia das dimensѕes de uma fenda ressonante em sua largura de banda de operaчуo
щ analisada. Para isso, um estudo paramщtrico da largura da fenda foi realizado atravщs do software de
simulaчуo eletromagnщtica Ansys HFSS. As anсlises foram realizadas partindo-se de uma antena com
dimensѕes calculadas atravщs de fѓrmulas aproximadas. Estruturas em fendas ressonantes possuem
aplicaчуo ampla na сrea aeroespacial, bem como em comunicaчѕes mѓveis de um modo geral, devido a
suas caracterэsticas de baixo peso, tamanho reduzido e facilidade de conformaчуo a superfэcies planas e
nуo planas. Os resultados mostram que р medida que se aumenta a largura da fenda, obtщm-se um
aumento na largura de banda de operaчуo da antena. A ampliaчуo da largura de banda de um elemento
irradiador garante р estrutura uma maior robustez, possibilitando, assim, o uso de mњltiplos canais de
comunicaчуo, maior trсfego de dados e maior tolerтncia р imprecisуo no seu processo de fabricaчуo

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Projeto e anсlise de uma rede de antenas em fenda em UHF para nanossatщlites meteorolѓgicos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo:

Este trabalho apresenta o desenvolvimento de uma rede de antenas para nanossatщlites de aplicaчуo meteorolѓgica. O principal objetivo deste trabalho щ descrever o estudo de uma antena compacta com baixo peso e boa eficiъncia operacional. Para satisfazer estes requisitos, uma rede de quatro antenas em fenda projetada com polarizaчуo circular a direita (RHCP) щ proposta. Para o desenvolvimento das simulaчѕes apresentadas, utilizou-se o software de simulaчуo eletromagnщtica Ansys HFSS. Os resultados obtidos demostraram bom desempenho em termos de largura de banda, ganho e razуo axial

Neste artigo, um estudo de defasadores em banda S usando componentes discretos щ apresentado. Um mщtodo para compensar a influъncia dos elementos parasitas, especialmente a capacitтncia parasita que surge devido р descontinuidade da linha de transmissуo do circuito, щ abordado. Os cсlculos para o dimensionamento dos componentes LC, a abordagem para compensaчуo de elementos parasitas e as simulaчѕes eletromagnщticas usando o software Ansys HFSS sуo descritos. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents the electromagnetic modeling of reflectarray antennas. By using the equivalent circuit model approach in spectral domain, the Green?s function for the structure has been calculated. The analysis is performed through the method of moments with entire-domain basis functions, such as sinusoidal, sinusoidal with segmented edge condition and sinusoidal without segmented edge conditions. The scattered
electric field is calculated by the stationary phase method. Commercial package Ansys Designer is employed to validate the results
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract:

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Compact UHF Printed Antennas for Nano-Satellites
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Compact UHF Printed Antennas for Nano-Satellites

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 14th European Conference on Antennas and Propagation - EuCAP 2020

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents the application of miniaturization techniques to UHF printed antennas designed for installation onto 8-U nano-satellites. The first structure studied is a rectangular dielectric resonator antenna and the second one is a compact reactive loaded slot antenna. Both radiators are used to compose four-element planar arrays. The analyzed topologies are compared, whereby the array composed of slot antennas yielded the lighter solution with good electromagnetic performance

The analyzed topologies are compared, whereby the array composed of slot antennas yielded the lighter solution with good electromagnetic performance

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: On the Use for Symmetry for Shaped-Beam Antennas Installed onto 8-U CubeSats

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 14th European Conference on Antennas and Propagation - EuCAP 2020

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This work describes the application of symmetry schemes and the Firefly Algorithm (FA) for the optimization of planar antenna arrays. The method is applied to non-uniformly spaced arrays composed of isotropic antennas operating in Sband (2.26 GHz) and installed onto an 8-U CubeSat. In order to demonstrate the potential of this technique, radiation patterns with isoflux distribution were synthesized, so as to allow illuminating the Earth surface with uniform power density. Good agreement with the desired masks has been obtained
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

This work describes the application of symmetry schemes and the Firefly Algorithm (FA) for the optimization of planar antenna arrays. Good agreement with the desired masks has been obtained

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

The performance assessment of a two-beam electronically switchable circularly polarized reflectarray
antenna based on single-layer circular microstrip patches with phase delay line stubs is presented. Preliminary numerical analysis demonstrates the reflectarray capability to switch its main beam between 9.1А and 18.2А from the boresight in K-band (17.7-20.2 GHz). A very simple preliminary model is used for the envisaged PIN diode switches. For an array with 20x20 unit-cells, the achieved gain is above 27.2 dBic and the side-lobe level is below ?18.2 dB at f0. Moreover, a remarkably low axial ratio of 1.1 dB is obtained for the whole frequency band of operation

A very simple preliminary model is used for the envisaged PIN diode switches. For an array with 20x20 unit-cells, the achieved gain is above 27.2 dBic and the side-lobe level is below ?18.2 dB at f0. Moreover, a remarkably low axial ratio of 1.1 dB is obtained for the whole frequency band of operation

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Single-layer rectangular patch antenna with two pairs of parallel slits
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Single-layer rectangular patch antenna with two pairs of parallel slits

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Microwave and Optical Technology Letters (Print)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: Marcos V. T. Heckler;Heckler, M.V.T.;Heckler, Marcos V. T.;Heckler, Marcos;Heckler, Marcos V.T.;MARCOS HECKLER

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This work describes a new single-layer rectangular patch antenna with two pairs of parallel slits designed for dual-band operation. Numerical analyses are presented using the IE3DTM and the ENSEMBLETM electromagnetic simulator softwares. A prototype was manufactured and good agreement between the measurements and the CAD predictions were observed. The results obtained with the proposed technical solution showed improvements in the antenna impedance bandwidth and in the radiation characteristics, while maintaining the same polarization direction over the entire operational frequency range

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: <![CDATA[Analysis of cylindrical microstrip lines using the discrete mode matching method]]>
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: <![CDATA[Analysis of cylindrical microstrip lines using the discrete mode matching method]]>

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: IEEE Microwave and Wireless Components Letters

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This letter presents an extension of the discrete mode matching (DMM) method to analyze microstrip lines conformed on cylinders. The DMM is well suited to the analysis of multilayered structures, since the fields must be only sampled at the interfaces between the dielectric layers. For the case of cylindrical microstrip lines, the structure is discretized only along one direction, whereas the analytical solution is obtained in the other with the Green's functions calculated using a full-wave equivalent circuit. The mathematical formulation of the present extension is given in this letter, followed by its application to compute the propagation constants for cylindrical microstrip lines
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

The mathematical formulation of the present extension is given in this letter, followed by its application to compute the propagation constants for cylindrical microstrip lines

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: <![CDATA[CYLINDRICAL: an effective CAD package for designing probe-fed rectangular microstrip antennas conformed onto cylindrical structures]]>
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: <![CDATA[CYLINDRICAL: an effective CAD package for designing probe-fed rectangular microstrip antennas conformed onto cylindrical structures]]>

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: IEEE Antennas and Propagation Magazine

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents a computer-aided design tool named CYLINDRICAL. The algorithm utilizes the cavity model to design and analyze linearly and circularly polarized probe-fed rectangular microstrip antennas conformed onto cylindrical structures. A brief description of the program is given. CYLINDRICAL was used to design a circularly polarized antenna to operate in the L1 band of GPS. Validation was further done with the Ansoft HFSS package. It was shown that the antenna dimensions given by the design algorithm of CYLINDRICAL needed to be only slightly changed in order to obtain an optimized circularly polarized radiator according to the HFSS software. The tool is also very suitable for teaching graduate courses on microstrip antennas

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents an efficient approach for the analysis of graded-index profile waveguides. The variation of the index of refraction is modeled considering a sufficient number of concentric dielectric layers, each with a different index of refraction. The propagation constant in the layered structure is calculated by setting up a full-wave equivalent circuit, which allows the derivation of the system equation for the whole structure. Two examples are given, including validation with the commercial software Ansoft HFSS

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-4: Guias de onda dielщtricos de seчуo elэptica

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This letter presents an extension of the discrete mode matching method to the analysis of dielectric waveguides with noncircular cross sections. The problem is analyzed in cylindrical coordinates expanding the fields in terms of Bessel functions. Matching of the fields tangential to the interfaces between different dielectric layers is ensured by applying the proper boundary conditions. The mathematical formulation is given in this letter, followed by its application to compute the propagation constants in elliptical dielectric waveguides

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Fast analysis of cylindrical microstrip lines printed on substrates composed of multiple layers
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Fast analysis of cylindrical microstrip lines printed on substrates composed of multiple layers

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Microwave and Optical Technology Letters (Print)

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This letter presents an analysis of microstrip lines that are printed on substrates composed of numerous dielectric layers using a fast technique that comprises the full-wave equivalent circuit and the discrete mode matching method. The validation of the proposed formulation has been done with a commercial package based on the finite-element method and very good agreement has been obtained. As a special application of our technique, we consider the analysis of microstrip lines printed on substrates with dielectric constants that vary according to given graded-index profiles. The profiles are modelled by replacing the substrate by numerous homogeneous dielectric layers
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Analysis of conformal microstrip antennas with the discrete mode matching method
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Analysis of conformal microstrip antennas with the discrete mode matching method

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: IEEE Transactions on Antennas and Propagation (Print)

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

An extension of the discrete mode matching (DMM) method is used to 
analyze microstrip antennas conformed to cylinders.
The structure needs to be discretized only along the azimuthal and
the axial directions by sampling the fields and current densities in
the interfaces between dielectric layers. The solution in the radial
direction is obtained analytically with the dyadic Green's function,
which is calculated using the full-wave equivalent circuit (FWEC)
in the spectral domain. The structure is truncated in the axial
direction by employing
absorbing boundary conditions (ABCs). The mathematical formulation
is given in this paper, followed by its application to compute the
main properties of conformal microstrip antennas, such as resonant
frequency, radiation patterns and input impedance. Validation with
the commercial software HFSS has been done and good agreement between
the results has been observed
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

An extension of the discrete mode matching (DMM) method is used to

direction by employing

is given in this paper, followed by its application to compute the
main properties of conformal microstrip antennas, such as resonant
frequency, radiation patterns and input impedance. Validation with
the commercial software HFSS has been done and good agreement between
the results has been observed

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Development of robust safety-of-life navigation receivers
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Development of robust safety-of-life navigation receivers

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: IEEE Transactions on Microwave Theory and Techniques

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper summarizes the development of safety-of-life receivers for global navigation satellite systems. Two receiver systems have been successfully fabricated, integrated, and tested by means of field experiments. Implementation issues of these two systems are described in this paper. The third generation of this receiving system is based on a dual-band approach with antennas that are able to separate two frequency bands using two outputs. Measured results show that high isolation between the two bands can be achieved

Measured results show that high isolation between the two bands can be achieved

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Radionavegaчуo e Radioastronomia

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

Drawing on authors from several German organizations, this two-part column describes some key results of the UniTaS IV project, a publicly funded effort to investigate special problems in the application of satellite navigation for aviation. Among the subjects covered: adaptive beamforming antennas, a GNSS landing system that incorporates inertial sensors with a ground-based augmentation system (GBAS), multi-constellation RAIM (receiver autonomous integrity monitoring), and jamming, spoofing, and authentication of signals

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Performance of microstrip antenna arrays installed on aircraft
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Performance of microstrip antenna arrays installed on aircraft

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Aerospace Science and Technology (Imprimщ)

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents simulations and measurements of microstrip antenna arrays installed on civil aircraft. The main purpose is to validate the numerical predictions of the installed performance with measurements using scaled mock-ups. All electromagnetic analyses are done using commercial software. Design and development of the antennas used for validation and particulars regarding the simulations are presented. Comparisons between simulations andmeasurements of installed performance are discussed in detail

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Dual-band antenna with highly isolated outputs for global navigation satellite systems receivers
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Dual-band antenna with highly isolated outputs for global navigation satellite systems receivers

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: IET Microwaves, Antennas & Propagation (Print)

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

 This paper describes the design of a dual-band microstrip antenna with four isolated outputs. The proposed antenna has been optimized to operate in the E5a/E5b and E1 bands of the European satellite navigation system Galileo. Each pair of outputs delivers the signal in only one of the operating bands; hence the antenna operates also as a diplexer. The operation principle, the design procedure and measured results are presented and discussed. It is demonstrated by means of measured results that the designed antenna exhibits high isolation between its output ports and that good performance in terms of radiation pattern and polarization purity was obtained
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

The operation principle, the design procedure and measured results are presented and discussed. It is demonstrated by means of measured results that the designed antenna exhibits high isolation between its output ports and that good performance in terms of radiation pattern and polarization purity was obtained

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Linear array design with switched beams for wireless communications systems
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Linear array design with switched beams for wireless communications systems

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: International Journal of Antennas and Propagation (Print)

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents an analysis for optimal design of switched beamforming applied to a linear array for wireless communication systems. The beam switching scheme provides coverage of a given sector in azimuth and controls the sidelobe level simultaneously. The analysis was developed considering arrays composed of Quasi-Yagi elements. The model assumes a user moving in the azimuthal direction under a constant velocity and with an estimation of the signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) at the mobile user (MU). The radio base station applies the beam that yields the best performance during transmission. The decision is based on the feedback information received from the MU. The goal of the analysis is to determine the best trade-off between the array size and number of feedback bits necessary to maximize the SNR at the receiver. The results show that a compromise between the number of beam-pointing directions and the array size should be taken into consideration for a wireless communication system design
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Synthesis and implementation aspects of linear antenna arrays with shaped radiation pattern for mobile communications
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Synthesis and implementation aspects of linear antenna arrays with shaped radiation pattern for mobile communications

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: IET Microwaves, Antennas & Propagation (Print)

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents a technique to design antenna arrays with shaped radiation pattern.
The efficiency of the proposed technique is demonstrated for the optimization of a linear microstrip
array for radio base stations of mobile communication systems. The main beam is shaped so as to
provide uniform distribution of power inside a sector of a cell and to minimize the power radiated
above the horizon. The synthesis of the shaped pattern is achieved by a combination of genetic
algorithm (GA) and sequential quadratic programming (SQP). In contrast to several papers found
in the literature that consider only isotropic antennas, the proposed approach takes into account all
the radiation properties of small arrays, such as the mutual coupling between the array elements
and edge effects. Finally, the design of the feeding system to produce the synthesized pattern is
discussed. Measurements are used to validate the proposed technique

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents a four-element linear arraycomposed of E-shaped microstrip antennas designed to switched-beam application in ISM band. Particle Swarm Optimization(PSO) algorithm is applied to optimize four different sets ofamplitude and progressive phase shift to achieve four distinctradiation patterns controlling the major lobe direction andsidelobe level. For this application, two restrictive approachesare presented for the implementation of PSO algorithm in orderto improve the algorithm convergence to feasible solutions

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents the study of a microstrip antenna to be installed onto meteorological nano-satellites. In order to increase the effective ground plane so as to improve the frontto-back ratio and the gain, metallic strips were attached to the antenna ground plane. The performance was evaluated using different types and sizes of metallic strips. An improvement in the front-to-back ratio whilst keeping good axial ratio performance
was observed. For validations, a prototype was manufactured and the measured results compared to the simulations

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: This article describes the design of a dual-wideband annular slot antenna. The proposed structure has been optimized to operate in the typical bands of mobile communication systems (0.824-0.960 GHz and 1.710-2.165 GHz). The antenna is designed considering two independent ports with high isolation, one for each operation band, yielding an antenna that exhibits diplexing feature. The final measured results show that the designed antenna exhibits stable radiation pattern over the frequency in both desired bands. The designed antenna has been used to compose a dual-band linear array. Simulation results indicate good performance in both bands for mobile communication systems

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract: 

This paper presents the design and characterization of an aperture-coupled microstrip antenna array to be installed onto a nanosatellite. The proposed antenna array has been optimized to operate at 2.26 GHz (S-Band), which is the operating frequency of the downlink channel of the Brazilian System for Meteorological Data Acquisition. The electromagnetic analyses are done by using the HFSS electromagnetic simulator. For the design validation, prototypes of single elements and antenna array were manufactured. The comparison between simulations and measurements indicates good performance of the designed antennas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This article describes a circularly polarized 2 з 2 microstrip antenna array with corporate feeding to be used at K‐Band (18.7‐19.2 GHz) as a reflectarray feed. A design approach is proposed for the improvement of axial ratio and impedance bandwidths of circularly polarized microstrip antenna arrays with sequential rotation. A parametric analysis is also proposed to evaluate accurately the array phase center position. An array prototype has been designed, fabricated, and tested. The good agreement obtained between simulation and experimental results provides validation of the design approach and proof of the proposed concept

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper describes the application of the Firefly Algorithm
for the optimization of linear and planar antenna arrays.
In order to demonstrate the potential of this technique, three applications
are reported. The first one is the synthesis of a radiation
pattern with isoflux distribution with a non-uniformly spaced linear
array composed of isotropic antennas. The second application is the
optimization of a non-uniformly spaced planar array composed of
isotropic radiators installed on an 8-U nanosatellite. Finally, the
optimization of a 3з3 planar antenna array for beam steering
with simultaneous sidelobe level control is described, whereby the
beamforming coefficients were allowed to assume only discrete
values. In the three cases considered, good agreement between the
desired (mask) and the optimized patterns has been obtained
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This letter presents the study of a segmented entire
domain basis function suitable for fast analysis of rectangular microstrip antennas with the method of moments (MoM). In contrast
to other basis functions, whereby the edge condition is valid only
for narrow lines, the proposed basis function can be applied to microstrip lines and antennas with arbitrary width. For validation,
a probe-fed rectangular microstrip antenna was modeled and the
results were validated with measurements. The deviation of the
calculated resonance frequency from the measured value could be
reduced to less than 0.1%. This has been obtained with the use of
only two expansion modes along each direction for the construction
of the MoM matrices

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: ASIP development of a real-time control module for a retrodirective antenna array
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: ASIP development of a real-time control module for a retrodirective antenna array

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: AEU-INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL OF ELECTRONICS AND COMMUNICATIONS

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

Electronically steerable antenna arrays become attractive due the possibility of simultaneously steering the main lobe in the desired direction and suppressing side lobes only by means of electronic control of excitation currents, hence avoiding mechanical components. However, this type of antenna requires intensive calculation for setting the excitation current of each array element in order to shape the radiation pattern for retransmission, thus demanding a dedicated hardware. This work reports the development of a digital control module for a retrodirective antenna array based on a customized dedicated microcontroller called PAMPIUM, which has been implemented on FPGA, aiming real-time response and low power consumption. A methodology for generation of optimized hardware in terms of area, power efficiency and performance is discussed. A design tool to provide the user with a practical and intuitive environment has been developed, which allows simulating and assessing statistics about execution and performance of the designed architecture. The developed digital control module is capable of updating the current coefficients of an eight-element antenna array in less than 1 s with a power consumption of 5.3 mW for beamsteering angles from 0А to 60А. The proposed methodology allows the demonstration of full efficiency of a retrodirective antenna array system

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Beamsteering and beamshaping using a linear antenna array based on particle swarm optimization
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Beamsteering and beamshaping using a linear antenna array based on particle swarm optimization

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: IEEE Access

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper discusses the architecture of an adaptive transmitting microstrip array that allows highly flexible beamsteering and beamshaping. The antenna array is digitally controlled by a field programmable gate array (FPGA) board. The power and phase of the excitation signals delivered to the array elements are optimized using an algorithm based on particle swarm optimization (PSO), which includes all electromagnetic effects such as mutual coupling and installed performance. Further, the efficiency of the proposed approach is validated by synthesizing various beam patterns, including side lobe level control and beam shaping for cosecant squared and isoflux contours. Very good agreement between simulated and measured results is thereby observed. The paper also addresses implementation aspects that are not reported in detail in literature, such as the compensation for the faulty antennas or transmitting channels, as well as the calibration procedure applied for the experimental validation of the proposed architecture.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: IEEE Antennas and Wireless Propagation Letters

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This letter presents a new approach for the enhancement of the axial ratio (AR) of a single-layer circularly polarized reflectarray antenna based on a circular microstrip patch with phase delay line stubs unit-cell. The AR improvement is achieved by inserting insets around the two stubs, changing the orientation of one of them and using a mirror symmetry arrangement. Two prototypes have been designed, fabricated and tested to proof the proposed concept in K-band. Good agreement has been obtained between numerical simulations and experimental results. The measured results confirm a remarkable AR improvement with values below 1 dB and 3-dB gain and AR bandwidths larger than 23.7%
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

This paper presents the design of a dual-band microstrip antenna with dual polarization characteristic for high altitude platforms (HAPs). The antenna has two isolated ports and is suitable for terminals with receiving and transmitting functions operating simultaneously. The element is designed for operation at 5.8 and 7 GHz with 100 MHz bandwidth in each band. The antenna geometry and its main design parameters are presented and discussed in the paper. Numerical and experimental results show that this radiator exhibits good performance in terms of impedance matching and circular polarization purity

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-LIVRO.TITULO-DO-LIVRO: Discrete Mode Matching Method for Conformal Microstrip Antennas
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-LIVRO.TITULO-DO-LIVRO-INGLES: Discrete Mode Matching Method for Conformal Microstrip Antennas

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

The present work describes the analysis of microstrip lines and antennas conformed on cylindrical and quasi-cylindrical structures with the discrete mode matching method (DMM). System of equations, which can be derived by using full-wave equivalent circuits that represent the electromagnetic field, must be solved to determine the characteristics of conformal microstrip structures. Lateral boundary conditions have been introduced to limit the discretized computational domain. Problems involving radiation have been analyzed by employing absorbing boundaries. In the DMM, the fields and currents are described by field expansions, where only the modes that satisfy the lateral conditions have to be considered. By analyzing different structures, the method has been validated against other techniques and good agreement between the results has been observed

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The invention relates to a dual band antenna, in particular for satellite navigation applications, comprising a multilayer structure that is provided with an upper first antenna element (12) for receiving electromagnetic waves having a frequency in a first frequency band, a lower second antenna element (16) arranged below the first antenna element (12) for receiving electromagnetic waves having a frequency in a second frequency band, two electrically conductive ground layers (20,28), a first and a second one, that are arranged one above the other and that are arranged in turn below the lower second antenna element (16), and a conducting-path layer (24) having at least one first conductive path (30,32) for electromagnetically coupling with the first antenna element (12) and having at least one second conductive path (34,36) for electromagnetically coupling with the second antenna element (16)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo: 

Nessa apresentaчуo, os procedimentos de projeto de algumas antenas de microfita desenvolvidas na UNIPAMPA serуo apresentados. A primeira geometria a ser descrita щ uma antena em fenda anelar com elevada robustez a tolerтncias do processo construtivo para sistemas GPS de precisуo. A segunda antena consiste em uma estrutura dupla-faixa para estaчѕes rсdio-base de telefonia mѓvel celular. A terceira geometria encontra-se em desenvolvimento e terс como principal aplicaчуo sistemas de comunicaчуo via satщlite operando em 5,8 e 7,0 GHz

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo:

Nesta palestra, serуo apresentadas as atividades de pesquisa recentemente concluэdas e em andamento no Campus Alegrete da Universidade Federal do Pampa (UNIPAMPA). Inicialmente, o projeto de uma rede de antenas para estaчуo rсdio-base (ERB) para 4G serс apresentado. Esta rede foi projetada para obtenчуo do lѓbulo principal com formato otimizado para proporcionar cobertura uniforme de sinal na cщlula de abrangъncia da ERB. Em seguida, resultados preliminares do projeto de antenas para nano-satщlites serс apresentado. Em especial, o enfoque serс dado para o desenvolvimento de antenas de microfita projetadas para os enlaces de subida (UHF) e descida (Banda S). Este nano-satщlite estс sendo desenvolvido em parceria com o Centro Regional do Nordeste do Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais (CRN/INPE) no тmbito do projeto "Constelaчуo de Nano-Satщlites" (Projeto CONASAT)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo: 

O foco da apresentaчуo щ a discussуo das etapas de desenvolvimento de uma rede de antenas com diagrama de irradiaчуo conformado: projeto do elemento simples para compor a rede de antenas, ferramenta computacional para sэntese do diagrama de irradiaчуo baseada em algoritmo genщtico, projeto do sistema alimentador, e caracterizaчуo experimental do protѓtipo. O cenсrio escolhido para o desenvolvimento da antena foi a cobertura de sinal com distribuiчуo de potъncia uniforme em uma picocщlula para sistemas 4G/LTE. Adicionalmente, os projetos de pesquisa em antenas em desenvolvimento na UNIPAMPA serуo apresentados

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: Design of a dual-band circularly polarized antenna for a Galileo demonstrator
DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO-INGLES: Design of a dual-band circularly polarized antenna for a Galileo demonstrator

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This Master Thesis presents the design of a novel antenna geometry for Galileo satellite navigation systems. This radiator is intended to improve the performance of an already designed antenna for the GALANT DLR?s internal project. Finally a dual-band, right hand circularly polarized, with isolated outputs, stacked patch microstrip antenna has been designed to fulfil the objectives of the project. The most important characteristic of this antenna is that it can be fed separately for the low frequency band and for the high frequency band with an isolation better than -25 dB between ports. This is the reason why the Institute of Navigation decided to register the patent of this antenna. The name of the invention is: ?Dual-Band Circularly Polarized Microstrip Antenna with Two Isolated Outputs Suitable for Navigation Systems?. The work has been structured in the following manner: First, a complete research on microstrip antennas is carried out, reflecting in this report only the ones that fit better to our specifications. Afterwards, an antenna geometry is chosen and approximately one month and a half is spent in order to adjust the characteristics in RF simulation applications. Once good results are obtained in the simulations, the chief of the department decides to register the patent of the antenna. Finally, the antenna is constructed and measured to check the results of the simulations. Moreover, at the end of the work period, a first adaptation of the antenna in order to build an array is carried out. Basically the adaptation consists on inserting the 90А Hybrids in the feeding layer of the antenna while taking into account restrictions in size
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This Master Thesis presents the design of a novel antenna geometry for Galileo satellite navigation systems. This radiator is intended to improve the performance of an already designed antenna for the GALANT DLR?s internal project. Finally a dual-band, right hand circularly polarized, with isolated outputs, stacked patch microstrip antenna has been designed to fulfil the objectives of the project. The most important characteristic of this antenna is that it can be fed separately for the low frequency band and for the high frequency band with an isolation better than -25 dB between ports. This is the reason why the Institute of Navigation decided to register the patent of this antenna. The name of the invention is: ?Dual-Band Circularly Polarized Microstrip Antenna with Two Isolated Outputs Suitable for Navigation Systems?. The work has been structured in the following manner: First, a complete research on microstrip antennas is carried out, reflecting in this report only the ones that fit better to our specifications. Afterwards, an antenna geometry is chosen and approximately one month and a half is spent in order to adjust the characteristics in RF simulation applications. Once good results are obtained in the simulations, the chief of the department decides to register the patent of the antenna. Finally, the antenna is constructed and measured to check the results of the simulations. Moreover, at the end of the work period, a first adaptation of the antenna in order to build an array is carried out. Basically the adaptation consists on inserting the 90А Hybrids in the feeding layer of the antenna while taking into account restrictions in size

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: Analysis of microstriplines composed of several dielectric layers under the application of the discrete mode matching
DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO-INGLES: Analysis of microstriplines composed of several dielectric layers under the application of the discrete mode matching

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagaчуo de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Microstrip structures became very attractive with the development of cost-effective dielectric materials. Among several techniques suitable to the analysis of such structures, the discrete mode matching method (DMM) is a full-wave approach that allows a fast solution to Helmholz equation. Combined with a full-wave equivalent circuit, the DMM allows fast and accurate analysis of microstrips lines on multilayered substrates. The knowledge of properties like dispersion and electromagnetic fields is essential in the implementation of such transmission lines. For this objective a MATLAB computer code was developed based on the discrete mode matching method (DMM) to perform this analysis. The principal parameter for the analysis is the utilization of different dielectric profiles with the aim of a reduction in the dispersion in comparison with one-layer cylindrical microstrip line, showing a reduction of almost 50%. The analysis also includes current density distribution and electromagnetic fields representation. Finally, the data is compared with Ansoft HFSS to validate the results
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Microstrip structures became very attractive with the development of cost-effective dielectric materials. Among several techniques suitable to the analysis of such structures, the discrete mode matching method (DMM) is a full-wave approach that allows a fast solution to Helmholz equation. Combined with a full-wave equivalent circuit, the DMM allows fast and accurate analysis of microstrips lines on multilayered substrates. The knowledge of properties like dispersion and electromagnetic fields is essential in the implementation of such transmission lines. For this objective a MATLAB computer code was developed based on the discrete mode matching method (DMM) to perform this analysis. The principal parameter for the analysis is the utilization of different dielectric profiles with the aim of a reduction in the dispersion in comparison with one-layer cylindrical microstrip line, showing a reduction of almost 50%. The analysis also includes current density distribution and electromagnetic fields representation. Finally, the data is compared with Ansoft HFSS to validate the results

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This work has been developed as a part of DLR?s (Deutsches Zentrum fќr Luft- und Raumfahrt) activities in Installed Performance of Antennas on Aerostructures ? IPAS project, which is being undertaken by ten European partners. The main purposes of the present research are to study the coupling effects of microstrip antennas conformed on cylindrical structures and the validation of numerical tools. The investigations have been performed using different antenna geometries. Comparison between the predictions using different software will be presented. The advantage and disadvantage of every tool will be discussed. Finally, the numerical results are compared with the measurements performed in the DLR?s Antenna Open Test Range ? AMA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
O presente documento engloba a elaboraчуo e apresentaчуo dos resultados de um cѓdigo em ambiente MATLAB com a finalidade de realizar o prщ-projeto e a anсlise de antenas de microfita simples. Para tal anсlise foram abordados alguns modelos numщricos e posterior-mente validados atravщs de simulaчѕes com os pacotes comerciais de anсlise eletromagnщtica Ansoft DESIGNER e HFSS.
O cѓdigo desenvolvido modela antenas de microfita retangulares alimentadas via prova coaxial utilizando os modelos da linha de transmissуo (LT) e cavidade ressonante. As caracte-rэsticas de irradiaчуo sуo obtidas considerando-se dois modelos: emprego de duas fendas irra-diantes e corrente elщtrica superficial em combinaчуo com a funчуo de Green da estrutura.
Com a comprovaчуo dos resultados pєde-se avaliar uma grande reduчуo em termos de tempo computacional em relaчуo aos mщtodos de onda completa e boa precisуo, o que щ de fundamental importтncia para o estudo de redes planares de antenas de microfita compostas de vсrios elementos.
Este trabalho serve como um ponto de partida para o estudo de mщtodos mais precisos e complexos, em uma posterior pesquisa de Pѓs-Graduaчуo, e tambщm irс resultar em uma fer-ramenta computacional que poderс servir de auxэlio a futuros trabalhos no Grupo de Estudos em Sistemas Eletrєnicos da UNIPAMPA
